loans.name: Sergio Manuel

texts.es:
El Sra. SERGIO MANUEL H. A. es trabajador del mercado Roberto Huembés, el se encarga de  Cobrar a todos los Comerciante del Mercado Roberto Huembés su ruta de cobro es diaria ya que pagan el piso que le brinda en el mercado. Es padre de familia, casado con un hijo este se encuentra en edad escolar.
El va utilizar la plata en compra de medicamento para su familiar que tiene enfermo a un familiar y la inversión  es para ese destino
El  Sr. Sergio dijo que gracias a los  prestamos otorgados me han ayudado mucho ya que e podido mejorar mi casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Sergio works in the Roberto Huembés and is in charge of collecting fees from those selling in the market. He does this job daily. He is married and has one school aged son. He will use the money from this loan to buy medicine for a sick family member. He tells us that he is grateful for these loans, as they have helped him improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medicine

loans.name: Blanca Orbelina

texts.es: Blanca Orbelina C. D. M. D. 34 años D. edad, vive junto a sus cuatro hijos, los cuales todos son menores D. edad, y quienes dependen por completo D. Blanca. Residen en el municipio D. Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Blanca posee una panadería, la cual esta ubicada frente a la zona franca D. Ilopango, lugar en donD. existen diferentes tipos D. negocio, y diferentes fabricas, en donD. trabajan cientos D. personas tanto en el día como en la noche, lo cual es muy beneficioso para ella, ya que sus ventas son bastante estables. Ella se encarga D. elaborar el pan, junto a su hijo mayor D. 17 años D. edad, el cual posteriormente entregan a otras tiendas pequeñas, y así mismo venden con los empleados D. la zona franca. Blanca solicita un préstamo por medio del cual obtenga el dinero necesario para invertir en la panadería, comprando harina, azúcar, sal, levadura y otros productos más, todo esto con el deseo D. aumentar su producción y así mismo D. mejorar sus ventas, el mayor deseo D. Blanca es D. poder solventar todas las necesidades D. sus hijos, ya que ella es madre soltera, por lo cual lucho día con día por salir adelante y darles todo lo mejor a ellos.
texts.en:
Blanca Orbelina C. D. M., 34, lives with her four children who are all minors and who depend entirely on Blanca. They live in the town of Ilopango, located in the department of San Salvador. Blanca owns a bakery which is located across from the Export Processing Zone, a place where various types of businesses exist as well as a variety of factories where hundreds of people work day and night. This is very beneficial to her, since her sales are quite steady. Along with her 17-year-old son, the eldest, she is in charge of making the bread which is then delivered to other small shops and also sold to the employees of the Export Processing Zone. Blanca is seeking a loan by which she may obtain money needed to invest in the bakery, purchasing flour, sugar, salt, yeast and additional items in order to increase her production and likewise improve her sales. Blanca’s greatest wish is to be able to afford all her children’s needs, since she is a single mother. This is why she works day by day to get ahead and proviD. all the best to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour, salt, sugar and yeast.

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es: José Francisco O. G. de 27 años es un joven muy responsable y trabajador, el cual se dedica a trabajar en su negocio propio el cual es una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad. Él vive junto a su padre de 70 años de edad quien trabaja como sastre, y junto a su madre la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. José trabaja todos los días de la semana en la tienda, la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación, en el municipio de Soyapango, contando con una posición muy buena para la venta ya que esta frente a una parada de buses en la cual día con día se acumula una gran cantidad de personas. Durante varios años que José se ha esforzado por incrementar su inventario, tratando de surtir con todo lo necesario para complacer los deseos de sus clientes y así mismo para aumentar sus ingresos. José solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar todo tipo de productos perecederos con los cuales no cuenta, así mismo para comprar pan francés, el cual es conocido también como pan tipo baguette, ya que este es muy vendido  tanto en las mañanas como en las noches, por esta razón el desea poder comprarlo por mayor.
texts.en:
José Francisco O. G., 27 years old, is a young, responsible, hard working man who works in his own business which is a store where he sells products of primary necessity. He lives with his father of 70 years who works as a tailor and his mother who takes care of the household activities. José works every day of the week in the store which is located in the house where he lives in the town of Soyapango, benefiting from a location that is very good for sales since it is in front of a bus stop where every day a large number of people gather. For several years José has strived to increase his inventory, trying to supply his clients with everything necessary to meet their wishes and in this way increase his income. José requests a loan through which he will be able to buy all types of perishable products which he does not now have, such as buying french bread which is also known as baguette bread since this type sells well in the mornings as well as the evenings. For this reason he wants to be able to buy it wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishable products of primary necessity.

loans.name: Norma Guadalupe

texts.es: Norma Guadalupe C. D. J. 38 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Su grupo familiar esta conformado por  sus cuatro  hijos todos menores D. 13 años D. edad,  los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su propia casa. En dicho negocia ella comercializa leche, pan, golosinas y otros productos más. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio, sobre todo con productos los cuales son muy básicos en el hogar. Ana desea mucho poder mejorar las ventas, ya que es ella quien se encarga D. solventar todos los gastos del hogar y D. sus cuatro hijos, esto debido a que Norma es madre soltera y es quien vela por todas las necesidad existentes en la casa, sobre todo desea poder brindarle los estudios necesarios a sus hijos ya que anhela poder brindarles un mejor futuro en el cual puedan salir adelante y defenderse por sí solos.
texts.en:
Norma Guadalupe C. D. J. is 38 years old and lives in the Soyapango municipality, located in the San Salvador department. Her family unit is comprised of her four children, all younger than 13 years of age, who are all in school. She has a store selling perishable products, located in her own home. In this business she sells milk, bread, sweets and other such merchandise. She is requesting a loan that will allow her to supply her business, especially with basic home products. She wants very much to improve her sales since she is the one in charge of paying all the expenses of her home and her four children. She is a single mother and is the one who watches over all the existing necessities of the house. Above all else, she wants to proviD. for the education of her children, giving them a better future in which they can get ahead and stand on their own.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of staple products.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es: Juan José C. R. de 23 años de edad, es un joven muy trabajador el cual posee su propio negocio, a pesar de ser independiente en muchos aspectos, aún reside con sus padres a quienes les ayuda con algunos gastos del hogar, así mismo vive junto a sus hermanos menores de edad quienes estudian. Juan José posee una sala de belleza la cual esta ubicada en el centro de Cojutepeque, lugar en el cual también reside junto a su familia, debido a su ubicación, su salón es muy visible para la mayoría de personas que transitan por el lugar, así mismo cuenta con tres años de experiencia, tiempo en el que ha ido obteniendo clientes fieles gracias a su excelente trabajo y servicio brindando, así mismo ha sabido aprovechar muy bien sus oportunidades, asistiendo a diferentes cursos en los cuales adquiere más experiencia, lo que lo hace más solicitado en el lugar. Juan solicita un préstamo ya que cuenta con el deseo de mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de productos profesionales para el cuidado del cabello, así mismo cremas para cuerpo y rostro y otros tipos de tratamiento para el cuidado de la imagen de las personas. Juan sueña con poseer un negocio aún más surtido en donde posea la capacidad para atender más clientes.
texts.en:
Juan José C. R. is 23 years old, a very hard-working young man who has his own business. Despite being self-reliant in many ways, he still lives with his parents who he helps with some of the household costs, and thus also with his younger siblings who are in school. Juan José has a beauty salon that is located in the center of Cojutepeque, which is also where he lives with his family. Due to its location, his salon is very visible to the majority of people that travel through the area and so he counts three years of experience, time in which he has been acquiring loyal customers thanks to his excellent work and service offering. In the same way he has learned to take advantage very well of his opportunities, attending different courses at which he gains more experience which makes him more popular in the place. Juan is requesting a loan since he has the wish of improving the conditions of his business, buying greater quantities of professional products for hair care and likewise body and face creams and other types of treatment for the care of peoples image. Juan dreams of having a business still more stocked in which he has the capacity to accommodate more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing hair- and skin-care products

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Silvestre

texts.es:
El Sr. Silvestre V. S. de 64 años de edad vive con su cónyuge. Tiene casa propia la cual se encuentra ubicada en la Coop. Sta. Dominguita del distrito de Santiago. Trabaja como chofer en su propio vehiculo generándole un ingreso diario. El Sr Silvestre tiene una familia muy emprendedora que ha salido adelante, siempre con la ayuda de su esposa quien trabaja como obrera de campo. El señor Silvestre solicita el crédito para terminar de construir su vivienda. Su sueño nos manifiesta es terminar de construir su vivienda y dedicarse mas adelante a la agricultura en su propia parcela. 
Agradece  por anticipado el apoyo brindado del presente financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mr. Silvestre V. S. is 64 years old and lives with his common-law wife. He has his own house in Santa Dominguita, in Santiago. He works as a taxi operator driving his own vehicle to earn his daily income. Mr. Silvestre's family is very enterprising and has gotten ahead in life--always with the help of his wife, who works as a farm laborer. Mr. Silvestre is asking for a loan to finish constructing his house. His dream is to finish building his house and in the future to work in agriculture on his own plot of land. He is thankful in advance for the support given him by the current loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes, and chicken

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos Alberto P. G. de 43 años de edad, reside en el pueblo de Cojutepeque, el cual esta ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Carlos Alberto posee un taller en el cual repara maquinas de coser, así mismo comercializa todo tipo de repuestos para estas. Él es un hombre muy responsable, el cual es un excelente proveedor en su hogar, vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y junto a su única hija de 16 años de edad, quien estudia educación media. Su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal de Cojutepeque, en donde trabaja de lunes a domingo reparando las maquinas de sus clientes, Carlos solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maquinas de coser por mayor así mismo comprar más repuestos como bobinas, fajas, garfios y otros más, todo con el deseo de contar con todos los productos relacionados con su trabajo, para poder contar con más clientes los cuales le permitan contar con mayores ganancias, así de esta forma Carlos desea brindarles todo lo necesario a su esposa e hija, Carlos es un hombre muy trabajador y dedicado a su familia quien anhela lo mejor para esta.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto P. G. is 43 years old and resides in the town of Cojutepeque, which is in the Department of Cuscatlán. He has a workshop where he repairs sewing machines and sells all types of related parts. Carlos Alberto is a responsible gentleman who is a good provider to his household. He lives with his wife, who is in charge of the household duties, and their 16 year old daughter who is in high school.

His business is located at the municipal market in Cojutepeque. Carlos Alberto works Monday through Sunday repairing the machines of his customers. He is requesting a loan so that he can buy sewing machines wholesale as well as parts such as bobbins, belts, hooks, and other items so that he has everything required to perform his work and attract more customers. This will allow him to increase his income so that he can provide everything his wife and daughter needs. Carlos is a hard worker who is dedicated to providing his family the best.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing machines & sewing machine parts

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Rudy Luis

texts.es: El solicitante vive en casa familiar tiene un hijo menor de edad y su conyuge se encuentra en chincha, el solicitante se dedica como musico director del grupo Calle 4, ademas estudia musica en las mañanas. El solicitante pide el credito para compra de instrumentos (organno musical)
texts.en:
Rudy lives at a relative’s house. He has a young son and his wife lives in Chincha. Rudy works as the music director of a group called “Calle 4”. He also studies music in the morning.

Rudy is requesting a loan to buy instruments (a musical organ).

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a musical instrument

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando es un padre de familia de 30 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a dos hijos en el sector Muy Finca, una zona rural dedicada a la agricultura que pertenece al distrito de Mochumí, la zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Orlando se dedica a trabajar desde que era muy joven criando y vendiendo animales, el cría aves domésticas en algunos corrales que tiene instalados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando sus aves ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona adquiriendo animales para revenderlos en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Este negocio le provee de algunos ingresos que utiliza en el sostenimiento de su familia, adicionalmente trabaja como peón agrícola en los cultivos de la zona. El desea adquirir más aves para aumentar sus ventas y percibir mas ingresos, por lo que ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme  Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es una persona tranquila y responsable, sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran alguien de confianza y que siempre está dispuesto a ayudar al que le necesita.
texts.en:
Orlando is a 30 year old father who lives with his wife and two children in the Muy Finca sector, a rural agricultural area in the district of Mochumí. This area is part of Lambayeque Province, which is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

From a young age, Orlando has worked raising and selling animals. He raises poultry in the pens he established behind his house. When the birds are fully developed, he sells them to the merchants who always pass through the area to acquire animals to sell in the city of Chiclayo.

This business provides some of the income he needs to support his family. In addition, he works as a farm laborer in the area. He wants to acquire more birds so that he can increase his sales and earn more income. For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

Orlando is a peaceful and responsible individual. His neighbors and acquaintances consider him to be someone who is trustworthy and always willing to help when needed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more birds to raise and sell

loans.name: Savoeun's Group

texts.en:
Mr. SavoeU. E. is the village bank president selected by the 22 members located in An L. Barang village in Kandal province. Each member of this village loan will use their portion to support their own purpose.

Mr. SavoeU. E., 55 years old, and his wife, Mrs. SU. C., are farmers who own 2.50 hectares where they grow crops and earn a small income to support their family. To support his farm Mr. SavoeU. E. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for a farm laborer.

The couple has three children; two are seamstresses in the garment factory and the third stays home and helps his parents with the farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay a farm laborer.

loans.name: Mr. Chhin Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has ten people who live in Trapeang Kralaong village in Takeo province. They all will use their portion of the loan for different purposes that improve their standard of living. 

Mr. Chhin S. is a village bank president who was selected by the other members. He was born in 1951. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of the land to cultivate rice to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Bour Men, is a door-to-door broom seller. Since his wife’s business is going well she wants to expand. So to improve this business, Mr. Chhin S. is applying for a loan to buy more brooms for resale. He is a father of three children: one also sells brooms, while the other two attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more brooms for resale

loans.name: Sok Kong's Group

texts.en:
The five people of this group loan selected Mrs. Sok Kong C. as their leader. The members live in An Long Barang village in Kandal province. Each member of this village loan will use their portion to support their own purpose.

Mrs. Sok Kong C., 41 years old, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates peanuts for a living. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and peanut seed.

Her husband, Mr. Kim Eng Ong, is a government worker who receives a small salary to support his family. They have two children; one is a construction worker and the other is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and peanut seed.

loans.name: Mrs. La Maen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people who live in Trapeang Kralaong village in Takeo province selected Mrs. La M. as village bank president. All the members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes that improve their standard of living.

Mrs. La M. is a broom seller who sells door to door. Since her business is going well she wants to expand so she is applying for a loan to buy more brooms to re-sell.

Her husband, Mr. Yi Chen, is a farmer with a half-hectare of land where he cultivates rice to support his family. He is also a construction worker. She is a mother of four children; one helps with the farming and the others are enrolled in local public school.

loans.use: To buy more brooms to resell.

loans.name: Naim's Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people who reside in An Long Barang village in Kandal province selected Mrs. Naim C. as their village bank president. All the members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes that improve their standard of living.

Mrs. Naim C., 55 years old, is a farmer with a plot of land where she grows crops to earn a small income to support her family. Mrs. Naim C. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay a farm laborer to plow her land.

Mrs. Naim C. is widow with six children; four are seamstresses in the garment factory, one is a construction worker, and one is a farmer who helps his mother with the farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay a laborer to plow her farm.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people who reside I. Kok Til village I. Kandal province selected Mrs. Sopheap S. as their village bank president. All the members will use their portion of the loA. for different purposes.

Mrs. Sopheap S. is a farmer who owns 1.5 hectare of land where she cultivates rice and earns a small income to support her family. She is asking for a loA. to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and to pay a farm laborer.

Mrs. Sopheap S., 55 years old, is a widow with two children; one is a seamstress I. a garment factory and the other is a student who helps with the farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and to pay a farm laborer.

loans.name: Mrs. Sokhin Kranh Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people who live in Chheu Teal village in Takeo province selected Mrs. Sokhin K. as village bank president. They all will use their portion of the loan for different purposes that improve their standard of living.

Mrs. Sokhin K. works at home as a weaver to earn money to support her family. Since her business is going well she wants to expand. She is seeking a loan to buy more silk.

Her husband, Mr. Gnoem Gnel, is a laborer. She is a mother of three children who are all enrolled in local public school.

loans.use: To buy more silk.

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people who live in Toul Doun Kam village in Kandal province selected Mrs. Sorn C. as the village bank president. Each member will use their portion of the loan for different purposes that improve their standard of living.

Mrs. Sorn C. is 40 years old and is a pig breeder while her husband, Mr. Srorng Noun, is an ice cream seller. With both these businesses they are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to help her pig business Mrs. Sorn C. is asking for a loan to buy piglets and pig food for breeding.

The couple has five children; four attend the local school and the youngest is 2 years old.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food.

loans.name: Mrs. Neth Ung Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of 13 people living in Chheu Teal village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Neth U. is the village bank president, selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan for a variety of purposes.  Born in 1969, Neth works at home as a weaver to earn some money to support her family. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is a laborer, while the others are studying in local public school. Her husband, Mr. Sophorll Ouk, is a farmer who owns a small piece of  land upon which he cultivates rice to sell to support his family. Since her business is going well, Neth wants to expand and so is requesting a loan to buy more silk.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Yoeun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoeun C. is the 67-year-old leader of this group loan, having been selected by its four members located in Edth Kaoh Phos village in Kandal Province. The members will use the loan to buy supplies, equipment and other items to support their various purposes.

Yoeun and her husband, Mr. Yin Long, are rice wine makers, and she also breeds pigs at home, a business for which she is requesting a loan to buy pig food. Yoeun is a mother of two children, one of whom is a student in the local school, while the other is 5 years old.

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: Linh's Group

texts.en:
Nine people who live in Preaek Touch village in Kandal province selected Mrs. Linh H. as their village bank president. Each member will use their portion of the loan for different purposes that improve their standard of living.

Mrs. Linh H. is a farmer who owns 2 hectares of land to grow crops. She is able to earn a small income to support her family. To support her farm she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

Mrs. Linh H. is a 52 year old widow with five children; two are construction workers, one is a soldier, one is a farmer, and the fifth is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Mrs. Touch Ouch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. TO. O. is the village bank president selected by the fifteen people who make up a group loan in Chheu Teal village in Takeo province. All members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. TO. O. is 39 years old. She works at home as a weaver to earn some money to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. Mrs. TO. O. is applying for a loan to buy more silk. Her husband, Mr. Sokha Gnan, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he cultivates rice to sell to support his family. The couple supports three children: one is a weaver while the others are studying at the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Mrs. Chantha Khen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fourteen people who live in Lekh Buon village in Kandal province. Mrs. Chantha K. is the village bank president selected by the other members, who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Chantha K. was born in 1968. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Vet Houn, is a construction worker. Their home does not have a lavatory to use. Mrs. Chantha K. is asking for a loan to construct a lavatory for her family's use. She is a mother of five children: two are seamstresses in a garment factory, two attend the local public school, and the youngest one is six years old.

loans.use: To construct a lavatory

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene L., 45, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Antonio L. Jr., 53, a welder, they are blessed in their marriage. Managing her own variety store for six years now, Arlene makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that her family can have a better life.

Arlene has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now, regularly attending their weekly fellowship meetings and consistently paying her weekly dues. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative, using the money she borrows to expand and improve her businesses.

To ensure the continued success of her business, she is now requesting a PHP 37,000 loan to be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business. Arlene will buy replenishment stock for her variety store. 

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she and her husband can live a well-off life.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Towards buying additional stocks to be incorporated into her current product inventory.

loans.name: Verk

texts.en: Verk S., 45, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She sells coffee and food to her new and existing customers for a gross income of USD 25 per day. Her husband is a soldier, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Mrs. V. is a middle-age woman and the mother of a young child, who is enrolled in primary school. She has a financial earner in Her husband is also a financial earner, growing rice crops for the purpose of eating and selling. V. built a medium pig stall where she raises a lot of hogs to earn a living. She has been engaged in this field since she was single, so she has a lot of experience. Because her pig-raising trade is the main source of family income, she has obtained a loan to use as capital to buy pig feed and to buy many piglets for her pigpen.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and many piglets for her pigpen.

loans.name: Lonn's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Lonn C. is the village bank president selected by the four people who make up a group loan in Preaek Ta Pov village in Kandal province. All members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Lonn C. is a tailor who earns some money to support herself because she is a widow and does not have a child. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. Mrs. Lonn C. is applying for a loan to buy fabric to design clothes for her customers.

loans.use: To buy fabric to design clothes

loans.name: Duk

texts.en: Duk S., 46, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. and her husband sell vegetables to her new and existing customers for an income of USD 7 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a trailer to attach to the motorbike. This will be used to transport workers from the factory. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a trailer to attach to the motorbike to transport workers from the factory.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng H., 51, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. H. sells food at a tourist place in the province for an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a doctor, earning an income of about USD 6.5 per day. H. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more medicine to sell and chickens to raise. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy medicine to sell and chickens to raise.

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Nhem Y., 58, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Y. sells groceries for an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Y. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a plot of farmland to expand the agriculture products from the rice fields. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Kem

texts.en: Kem S., 35, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. provides water supply in her village, with her husband, for an income of USD 2.5 per day. Her husband is also a construction worker, earning an income of about USD 2.5 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a water pump to get the water to supply the village for more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a water pump to get water to supply the village.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok T., 30, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. T. sells groceries for an income of USD 3.5 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of about USD 3.1 per day. T. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok K., 29, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. K. sells fruit for an income of USD 3.5 per day. Her husband is a taxi driver, earning an income of about USD 6 per day. K. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase more fruit to expand the current business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to expand the business.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en: Mrs. Kan A. has been spending her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she had learned from her grandparent when she was young. She is now married and has three school-aged kids. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing crops is an annual action with which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall is good for growing, however, Kan A. doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm. So, Kan A. is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides, pump machine, and seeds for planting activities.

loans.name: Tasneem's Group

texts.en:
Tasneem lives in Multan, Pakistan with her husband and children. Her husband sells bangles, while Tasneem takes care of her family by staying at home. 
As Eid (Muslim celebration, which comes after Ramadan) season is coming near within few months, her husband wants to buy more varieties of bangles. 
Tasneem has applied for a loan which will enable her husband to offer more variety of bangles to his clients, particularly on EID season, which can make a lot of money for them.

loans.use: To purchase bangles for reselling.

loans.name: Oeun's Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of six people who live in Peam Reang Leu village in Kandal province. All members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Oeun L., 36, is the group leader selected by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Phorlla Chan, are farmers who own a three-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to support their family. Their problem is that their field is infertile. So to improve production, Mrs. Oeun L. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and to rent a plowing machine to plow her field. She is the mother of three children: one is a laborer, one attends the local public school, and the youngest one is five years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to rent a plowing machine

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong K., 41, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. K. sells dessert in the city for an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. K. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband, to increase his customer numbers. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Thel

texts.en: Thel C., 41, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. C. is a farmer and sells Cambodian traditional cakes for an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of about USD 4 per day. C. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase cows to help plow the rice field. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy cows to help plow the rice field

loans.name: Haor's Group

texts.en: Five people living in Ampil Tuek village in Kandal province make up a group loan. Mrs. Haor S. is the group leader selected by the other members, who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Haor S. was born in 1956. She is the mother of four children who all are married and she is a widow with an eight member household. She owns a general store in the local village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. Mrs. Haor S. is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to resell.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to resell

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok C., 48, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. C. and her husband are farmers and earn an income of USD 1 each per day. C. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a new motorbike for one of her children to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey L., 47, is the village bank president selected by the seventeen members of this group loan, located in Leuk Daek village in Kandal province. All members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes.
 
Mrs. Srey L. is a farmer who owns 1-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice and her husband, Mr. Hara Maem, is a construction worker. With both of these occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. The farm's soil is now infertile and there is not enough water to irrigate the crops. Thus, Mrs. Srey L. decided to ask for a loan to buy gasoline for her water machine and to buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seed to support her crop. Mrs. Srey L. is the mother of five children: one is a construction worker, one is a waiter in a restaurant and the others attend the local school and also help their parents with the farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seed and gasoline for her water machine

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida S. lives with her husband and children in Multan, the city of sweetmeats and clothes in Pakistan. She financially supports her husband by selling clothes and doing sewing. She takes orders from her neighbors


She wants to purchase another sewing machine; she will also hire a helper who will help her to complete larger orders on time. She has applied for a loan for that purpose. 



She hopes that growing her business will increase her income and enable her family to have a better life. 

Note: "Shahida is showing her clothes in this picture".

loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine

loans.name: Key

texts.en:
Key V. was born in 1969 and is a married woman. She currently lives in Siem Reap Province. She was married here and has giV. birth to four children. All four are employed and earn money to help meet the family's living expenses. 


Since 2005, Key V. has run a business selling fish and some groceries in the local Psa Kraom Market, and is currently earning an average of $3 per day. Her husband works as a domestic carpenter. As her old house needs repairs, Key V. will be using half of the loan to mend it. She will use the other half to buy a used motorcycle for her children to ride to work.

loans.use: To mend an old house and to buy a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Mr. Sarun Yen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of ten people living in Ampil Tuek village in Kandal Province. Mr. Sarun Y. is the village bank president, selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan for various purposes.

Sarun is a fisherman, selling his catches to support his family. He is now applying for a loan to repair his fishing boat. His wife, Mrs. Yut Luy, is a baby shell seller. Sarun has six children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the others are attending local public school.

The day of the loan disbursement Mr. Sarun Y. was busy working, so his wife, Mrs. Yut Luy, shown in the above photo, received the loan for him.

loans.use: To repair his fishing boat

loans.name: Phy

texts.en:
Mr. S., 25, is a good father caring for a lovely young child. He and his wife currently earn their daily income by selling fresh fish in Psa Tmeiy Market located in Siem Reap Province. This young couple retails fish that they buy in bulk from their wholesale suppliers who are fishermen who fish along the river. 

They have been running this business for over nine years and have done so with great success. S. is now very busy with his business activities because there is an increasing number of clients wanting to buy the fish he sells. In order to satisfy the customers' requirements, S. requested a loan for capital to order various types of fish to sell. He intends to use some of the loan to repair his old house.

loans.use: To order various types of fish to sell to his regular customers.

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita G., 55, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Romeo G., a carpenter, they are blessed with five children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own rug-and-curtain making business for quite some time now.

Agapita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her rug and curtain business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a 12,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by allowing her to buy raw materials needed to continue production of her rugs and curtains. She will be buying fabric, thread, newspapers for patterns and filler fabrics.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education. She wants them to have a bright future.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: buying raw materials needed to continue production of her rugs and curtains. She will be buying fabric, thread, newspapers for patterns and filler fabrics

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim Y. owns a boutique in a market near her home in Multan, Pakistan. She started this business because her husband’s income was not enough to cover the basic needs of the family. She has been doing this work for the last six years. She creates and sells stitched and embroidered clothing in her boutique which she prepares with the help of her daughters. They all work hard to show their work in all its variety to attract more customers.  

As her boutique is placed in the market, she faces high competition with other clothing shops. For this reason she always needs variety in her clothes so that the customers come to her.

She has applied for a loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institution in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva) and will invest the capital in her boutique. This will help her to buy required materials in bulk such as fabric, thread and sketches and will increase her income. 

Note: "Shamim is showing her embroidery work in this picture".

loans.use: Purchase materials for making clothing to display and sell in her boutique

loans.name: Noeurn's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is made up of two people in the Chrey Young village in Kandal province. Mrs. Noeurn K. is the group leader, selected by the other member, who will use her own portion of their loan for her own business-related purpose. At age 52, Mrs. Noeurn K. is a widow. She has one child, who is a musician. 

Mrs. Noeurn K. is a farming laborer and farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. She sells the rice to support her family. Her problem is that her field contains infertile soil. Therefore, to improve production, she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan, she hopes to hire one or two farming laborers to help her grow her rice.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice field

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma A., age 39, is from the village of San Marcos. She and her husband have three school-aged children. To make a living, Vilma plants a variety of vegetables and sells these in their community. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Vilma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Vilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seedlings. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Vilma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Saira's Group

texts.en:
Saira lives with her family in Multan, Pakistan. Multan is a city known for its sweetmeats and clothing.  She supports her family financially by operating a small boutique at her home. She is very good at her work and gets regular orders, but most of the time she faces problems in fulfilling them. 

She wants to buy the latest sewing and embroidering machine which will save her time so she will be able to work more efficiently. For this purpose she has applied for a loan from Asasah. 

Note: "In this picture Saira is sewing on her old sewing machine".

loans.use: Purchase the latest sewing and embroidery machine for her boutique

loans.name: In's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by four borrowers who live in a commune of Siem Reap Province. Its leader, Mrs. In S., 55, has been fisH. with her husband for twenty years so they have much experience in this sector. This couple can make their daily income of $4 a day to help solve their family’s financial crisis.

In S. has given birth to four children, two of whom are married while the other two are single and help with their parents' fisH.. In S. requests a loan to buy more fisH. tools which she will use to increase her productivity. 

The other three borrowers also operate fisH. businesses. 
Mrs. H. needs a loan to purchase more tools for fisH..
Mrs. S. is applying for a loan to buy nets and traps for fisH..
Mrs. S. will be using a Kiva loan for capital in order to buy tools for her fisH. activities. 

Note: Mrs. S. was not available for the photograph, so her husband is shown instead.

loans.use: To buy more fishing tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and nutrients for the production of peppers

loans.name: Reaksmi's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five people in Preak Ta Thok village in Kandal province. Mr. Reaksmi K. is the group leader, selected by the other members, who will use their portions of the loan for different business purposes. 

Mr. Reaksmi K. was born in 1982. He manufactures white wine at his home to make a living. His wife, Mrs. Malia Phorl, is a seamstress in a garment factory, whose small salary is combined wth her husband's to support themselves and their child, who is enrolled in the public school. 

Although they both try to work hard, they need to earn a higher income. Mr. Reaksmi K. wants to start a new business, raising pigs, but they do not presently have enough money for such an endeavor. To reach his goal, Mr. Reaksmi K. is asking for a loan to buy piglets for breeding.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding

loans.name: Tahira's Group

texts.en:
Tahira A. is a resident of Multan, Pakistan where she has an embroidery business. She takes orders from nearby areas and fulfills them in order to make money. She has eight years of experience in this work. She learned this art from her mother at a young age and now is being rewarded in the form of money for her talent. Her art is also helping her to improve her family's standard of living. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Asasah because she wants to expand her business. With the loan she will buy fabric and embroidery materials in bulk. In this way she will be able to work more and fulfill larger orders.

loans.use: Purchase embroidery materials and fabric for her embroidery business

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Pich T., 35, is married and resides with his wife and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. T. is a motor-taxi driver and earns an income of $3 per day. His wife produces hummocks (spelled "hammocks" in English), earning an income of about $1 per day. T. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a trailer to attach to the motorbike. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house.  This is his second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. T.'s wife appears in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy a trailer to attach to his motorbike

loans.name: Nub

texts.en: Nub Y., 53, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. Y. produces hummocks ("hammocks" in English) for an income of $1 per day. Her husband is a motorbike repairman and a farmer, earning an income of about $1 per day to help cover the family expenses. Y. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase motorbike spare parts for her husband to expand his business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy motorbike spare parts to expand her husband's business

loans.name: Svay

texts.en:
Svay P., 47, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. P. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of about $1 each per day to help cover the family expenses.

One of her children (shown here) is a construction worker, earning an income of about $4 per day. P. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase construction materials to expand her child’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. 

P.'s son (the construction worker) and his family appear in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to expand her child's business

loans.name: Loemheang's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is made up of six members in Preaek Hang village in Kandal province. All the members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes, with the goal of improving their individual businesses. 

Mrs. Loemheang M. is the group leader, selected by the six members. She is 35 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Hak Sroeurn, are farmers who own a half-hectare plot of land on which they grow crops, which they sell to support their family as well as to pay their farming laborers. They have a child currently enrolled in the local public school.

Their current obstacle is that it is time to plow their field and harvest their crops, but they do not have enough money. Therefore, Mrs. Loemheang M. is asking for a loan in order to rent a plow machine in order to plow her field.

loans.use: To rent a plow machine in order to plow her field

loans.name: Farhat Firdous' Group

texts.en:
Farhat firdous lives with her husband and children in Multan, Pakistan. She belongs to a poor family, as her husband’s income is not enough to cover the expenses of their family.  

That’s why farhat had to start her embroidery business to fulfill the needs of her family. At first she did embroidery work only for her neighbors but now she wants to expand the business. She has applied for a loan from Asasah to buy embroidery supplies and fabric in bulk to fill larger orders. She also has a plan to hire an assistant who will take orders for her from other areas of the city. 

Farhat is very hopeful that she can improve her family's standard of living by increasing her income.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery supplies and fabric for her embroidery business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and nutrients necessary for the production of cayenne peppers

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo S., 33, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples.

S. is employed at the garment factory for an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband produces soy sauce, earning an income of about USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 350 to purchase more soy beans to produce more soy sauce. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy soy beans for her husband to produce more soy sauce

loans.name: Duk

texts.en:
Duk M., 40, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples.

M. is a teacher of illiterate people in her village and earns an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband sells brooms, earning an income of about USD 2 per day to help cover the family expenses.

M. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a truck for one of her children to use to transport workers from the factory. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a truck for one of her children to transport workers from the factory

loans.name: Mrs. Sanh Bor Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people make up this village bank loan in Toul Sala village in Kandal province. All the members will use their portions of the loan for different purposes with the goal of improving their businesses.

Mrs. Sanh B., age 48, was selected as the group loan leader by her fellow loan members. She is a farmer and owns a small piece of land on which to cultivate rice, which she sells to support her family. Since her farming endeavor is going well, she wants to expand. Therefore, to improve production, Mrs. Sanh B. is applying for a loan in order to buy another small piece of land for growing rice. 

Her husband, Mr. U Soeurng, is a fisherman. They have five children, three of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory. The younger two are enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a small piece of land for growing rice

loans.name: Khot

texts.en:
Mrs. K. is an older mother blessed with six children, all of whom are single. To help the family, two of her children are working in Malay.

K. raises a few pigs and rice crops on her own land next to her house. She always receives help from her husband in this business operation.

The coming rainfall season is good for growing, but K. lacks money to buy supplies to use on her farm field. This is why she has decided to ask a loan to buy seed to plant and fertilizer, as well as to buy another piglet for her stall.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizers plus another piglet to raise

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel R. O. is a 34-year-old father of two who lives in the region of Coquital de Los Chiles de San Carlos, located in Northern Costa Rica. The rural zone where Noel and his family live is one of the few places in Costa Rica without running water; the family must pump water from a nearby well as needed. Noel is working hard towards the sustenance of his family, striving to reap the maximum benefits from his land and his labor.

Noel is a dedicated farmer and father. He plans to focus his efforts on the planting and harvest of tabasco peppers. He works in cooperation with his wife to strike a balance between accomplishing the daily tasks associated with agricultural production and the completion of domestic responsibilities. The land they work is their own. In addition to his agricultural activity, Noel works at a local orange-processing factory as a harvesting laborer in order to supplement the family income. The money he earns helps pay bills for electricity and food.

Although this is an individual loan, the community in which Noel and his family live is very close-knit and interdependent. Neighbors help and support one another by sharing experiences and expertise acquired over the years. All members of the Coquital community are dedicated to the improvement of living conditions for the region as a whole.

This loan will be used to finance the production of tabasco peppers. Specifically, the loan will be used to finance the purchase of a variety of seedlings and necessary agricultural nutrients, fertilizers and chemicals in order to ensure a healthy harvest. All labor and logistical tasks associated with production will be carried out by Noel with the help of his family members. Noel will need roughly one year before his peppers reach maturity and are ready for harvest.

Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial, or PROPICA, is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Coquital, thus ensuring that their products will reach market. 

In general, the work day is divided into mornings and afternoons. In the mornings, the domestic tasks are carried out: cooking, cleaning and sending the children to school. Afternoons are generally dedicated to harvesting, planting, and working the land as needed. Noel spends some days working as a laborer in the nearby orange-processing factory but this work is sporadic.

Noel says the main factor that has stood in the way of increasing his production levels has been the Costa Rican government and various other institutions. Formal banks, lending agencies and government bodies have failed to recognize the producers of the Coquital region as legitimate producers, worthy of financial and governmental support and services. 

The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA represents a unique opportunity to Noel, his family and his community. By offering a source of start-up capital and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, this is a chance to improve family and community standards of living. Above all, Noel wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented; he wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in his neighborhood.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and nutrients necessary to the production of tabasco peppers

loans.name: Srouy's Group

texts.en:
This group, which consists of four members, is located in Tuol Sala village in Kandal province. They have selected Mrs. Srouy K. to be their group leader. All members of the group will use a portion of the loan to for different purposes.

Mrs. Srouy K. is a 42-year-old married woman. She and her husband, Mr. Tak Toeng, have three children, two of whom are enrolled in local public school, while the youngest one is five years old. She and her husband are farmers. They own a very small piece of land, where they grow vegetables to sell to support their family. Recently, they have experienced some problems because their field has infertile soil; in addition, even though it is time to plow the land, they do not have sufficient capital to do so. As a result, to improve crop production, Mrs. Srouy K. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and to rent a plow machine.

loans.use: To improve crop production by purchasing fertilizer and renting a plow

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim lives in Multan, Pakistan, the city of sweetmeats and tombs along with her husband and children. Her husband sells milk. Shamim is a very good house wife, she not only takes care of the home but also does sewing work in her spare time. She takes orders from her neighbors and fulfills them.

She wants to improve her business by purchasing a new sewing machine because the old one is not in good working condition. She thinks that she can make even more money by adopting this business as a fulltime work. 

In the future she plans on buying a buffalo by saving money from her sewing work and she is very hopeful that she will be able to achieve her target very soon.

loans.use: Purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Tang

texts.en:
Tang L., 25, is married and resides with her husband and a young child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for their pre-Angkorean temples. L. produces cow harnesses for an income of USD 1.6 per day. Her husband sells ice-cream and a construction worker, earning an income of about USD 5 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

L. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more nylon robes to produce more cow harnesses to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy nylon ropes to produce more cow harnesses to sell

loans.name: Nuth

texts.en:
Nuth V., 30, is married and resides with his wife and a young child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples. V. is a security guard for a private company and earns an income of USD 3.3 per day. His wife sells groceries at home, earning an income of about USD 1.6 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

V. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase more groceries to stock his wife’s store. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house.  This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Mrs. L., 53 years old, lives in the province of Kompong Tom, Cambodia, where she owns and farms a plot of land next to her house, raising pigs and crops to earn a living. She crops twice a year, and she was taught how to raise pigs and farm by her grandfather. She is a good mother and has four children. Two children are now married and live away from home, while the other two are single. Her husband works on the farm with her. L. doesn’t have enough supplies to use on the field during this coming rainfall season. So, L. has requested a loan to hire a laborer to plow the farmland and then to buy fertilizer and seed to grow. Note: Mrs. L. was busy at her business activity when the photo taken so her married son is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed to grow.

loans.name: Iv

texts.en:
Iv S., 44, is widowed and resides with one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. S. sells groceries for an income of USD 4 per day. Her child is employed at a private company, earning an income of about USD 4 per day to help cover the family expenses.

 S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Vorng

texts.en:
Vorng S., 31, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples.

Morn weaves Cambodian traditional silk for an income of USD 4 per day. Her husband is employed at a local garment factory, earning an income of about USD 5 per day to help cover the family expenses.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase more raw silk to produce silk products to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy raw silk to produce more silk products to sell

loans.name: Shonazar

texts.ru: Сулаймонов Шоназар проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 34 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Он в основном продает шнурки для обуви, ножницы, брелок, т.е. разную мелочь. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Shonazar S. lives in the J. Rumi region. He is 34 years old. He is married and has three children. He has secondary education. He has been selling on the market for more than five years. Shonazar mainly sells shoe laces, scissors, keychains and other small items. He is asking for a loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen P., 36, is married and resides with his wife in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples.

P. is a farmer and earns an income of USD 1 per day. His wife is employed at a garment factory in the city, earning an income of about USD 2 per day to help cover the family expenses.

P. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting to work

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina lives in Multan, Pakistan with her husband and children. She operates a sewing business in her home to financially support her husband who is a daily wage laborer. She has hired a worker who takes orders from the nearby areas for her and she completes them on time. She pays him on a monthly basis from her earnings.

Now, Zarina wants to buy a new sewing machine because the old one is not in a working condition and gives problems during sewing. She also has a plan to hire a tailor for fulfilling orders on time. She is hopeful that in this way she can increase her household income and also improve her family’s living standard.

In the photo, these ladies are holding a piece of Zarina’s cloth that she has for sewing.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and nutrients necessary for producing peppers

loans.name: Chou

texts.en: A mother of four teenaged children who are employed at various jobs, Mrs. Chou M. has spent her life cultivating crops, a skill she learned from her grandparent when she was young.  Chou M. has had great success growing crops, planting at least twice a year by following both the rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall will be good for growing, but she needs a loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting.  Her husband earns a living by selling chickens around the community.

loans.use: To use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Sareth's Group

texts.en:
This group, which consists of four people, is based in Veal village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sareth T. has been selected by the other members to be the group leader. The members will each use a portion of the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Sareth T. is 42 years old. She owns a general store, where she earns money to support her family. Since her business has been doing well, she would like to expand the business. To achieve this goal, Mrs. Sareth T. is applying for a loan to buy more groceries to resell. Her husband, Mr. Koy Tout, is a farmer. Specifically, her husband owns a 2-hectare plot of land, where he cultivates rice to sell to support their family. This couple supports four children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the others attend a local public school.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional groceries

loans.name: Mrs. Lorn Chheng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This group, which consists of nine people, is based in Veal village in Kandal province. The group members have selected Mrs. Lorn C. to be the village bank president. The members will each use a portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their respective businesses.

Mrs. Lorn C. was born in 1964. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land, on which she cultivates rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Mich Phat, is a fisherman. They are experiencing problems with their home because it is too old to live in. To take on this problem, Mrs. Lorn C. is applying for a loan to build her house. She is a mother of seventeen children: two of her children are seamstresses in a garment factory, others are construction workers, while others are students in a local public school.

loans.use: To improve her family's house

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en:
Arnulfo S. M. is a 56-year-old pepper farmer and father of five who lives in the region of Coquital de Los Chiles de San Carlos, located in Northern Costa Rica. The rural zone where Arnulfo and his family live is one of the few places in Costa Rica without running water; the family must pump water from a nearby well as needed. Arnulfo is working hard towards the sustenance of his family, striving to reap the maximum benefits from his land and his labour.

Arnulfo is a dedicated farmer and father. He plans to focus his efforts on the planting and harvest of tabasco and cayenne peppers. He works in cooperation with his wife to strike a balance between accomplishing the daily tasks associated with agricultural production and the completion of domestic responsibilities. The land they work is their own. In addition to his agricultural activity, Arnulfo works at a local orange-processing factory as a harvesting laborer in order to supplement his family income. The money he earns helps pay bills for electricity and food.

Although this is an individual loan, the community in which Arnulfo and his family live is very close-knit and interdependent. Neighbors help and support one another by sharing experiences and expertise acquired over the years. All members of the Coquital community are dedicated to the improvement of living conditions for the region as a whole.

This loan will be used to finance the production of tabasco and cayenne peppers. Specifically, the loan will be used to finance the purchase of a variety of seedlings and necessary agricultural nutrients, fertilizers and chemicals in order to ensure a healthy harvest. All labor and logistical tasks associated with production will be carried out by Arnulfo with the help of his family members. Arnulfo will need roughly one year before his peppers reach maturity and are ready for harvest.

Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial, or PROPICA, is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Coquital, thus ensuring that their products will reach market.

In general, the work day is divided into mornings and afternoons. In the mornings, the domestic tasks are carried out such as cooking, cleaning and sending the children to school. Afternoons are generally dedicated to harvesting, planting, and working the land as needed. Arnulfo spends some days working as a laborer in the nearby orange-processing factory, but this work is sporadic.

Arnulfo says the main factor that has stood in the way of increasing his production levels has been the Costa Rican government and various other institutions. Formal banks, lending agencies and government bodies have failed to recognize the producers of the Coquital region as legitimate producers, worthy of financial and governmental support and services.

The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA represents a unique opportunity to Arnulfo, his family and his community. By offering a source of start-up capital and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, this is a chance to improve family and community standards of living. Above all, Arnulfo wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented; he wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in his neighborhood.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and nutrients necessary for the production of peppers

loans.name: Abdugafor

texts.ru: Мусофиров Абдугафор проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 42 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Абдугафор имеет среднее образование. Занимается торговлей на рынке. У него товар со смешенным ассортиментом. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 5 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Abdugafor M. lives in the J. Rumy region. He is 42 years old. He is married and has five children. His wife is a homemaker. Abdugafor has secondary education. He does sales on the market and has a mixed variety of inventory. He has been in this business for five years. He is asking for a loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Khan

texts.en:
Mr. Khan V., 48, makes a living by selling fish that he buys from fisherman. Currently earning an average of $2 a day, he has been running his business for several years. His wife, 49, raises pigs and grows rice on their plot of land.

Khan V. is the father of seV. adult children, two of whom are now married and living away from home, while the other five are single. He has an unemployed daughter who he wants to establish in a grocery business and so is requesting a loan for her to use as capital to begin the enterprise.

loans.use: To mend an old house and to buy a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Mrs. Sarin Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan is made up of twelve people who live in Veal village, in Kandal province. Mrs. Sarin C. is a village bank president, selected by the other members, who will each use a portion of the loan for different purposes. She is 41 years old. She is a farmer who owns plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Choun Be, is a fisherman. Now she has a problem because her husband’s fishing supplies are too old to use. So to improve fishing, Mrs. Sarin C. is asking for a loan to buy some fishing supplies. She is a mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local public school, while the youngest one is four years old.

loans.use: To buy some fishing supplies.

loans.name: Nicasio Arsenio
