Vicente es un padre de familia que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el distrito agrícola de Cayaltí, un distrito que ha venido experimentando un creciente desarrollo comercial en estos ultimos años, la zona se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Trabaja brindando servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi, las mototaxis son vehículos conformados por una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades de transporte, el uso de estos vehículos como medio de transporte es muy utilizado en la zona por su precio y comodidad.

Vicente brinda su servicio dentro de la ciudad donde vive y también en los caseríos aledaños, el contínuo uso otorgado a su vehículo y el estado accidentado de las carreteras y caminos de la zona han hecho que su unidad móvil empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento, para realizar esta acción, el se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Vicente es una persona entregada a su familia, el desea apoyar a los suyos trabajando arduamente todos los dias. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Vicente is a family man who lives with his wife and children in the agricultural district of Cayaltí. This district has been experiencing growth in commercial development over the past few years. The area is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Vicente provides transport services of cargo and passengers using his motorcycle taxi. Motorcycle taxis are vehicles that consist of a motorcycle and an attached cabin for transporting items. The use of these vehicles is the primary mode of transportation in the area because of the price and the ease in which they get around.

Vicente provides his services throughout the city where he lives as well as in the neighboring villages. Continued use of his vehicle and the worn state of the highways and roads have caused defects in his vehicle that require urgent repairs. To ensure that his vehicle runs properly, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

Vicente is devoted to his family and works hard every day to support them. He previously worked with Edpyme Alternativa and has demonstrated that he is a client who is prompt and responsible when submitting his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance & repairs to his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Pure Heart Borrower Group

texts.en:
Charcoal is obtained from burning a piece of fresh timber in the absence of oxygen. It is one of the most common sources of energy for cooking in every traditional home. It is also the most affordable. Selling charcoal is one the lucrative businesses for many women like Juliana. Juliana is a 50 year old woman. She purchases bags of charcoal in bulk and retail to customers in her community for the past two years. She also trades in plastics materials. She plans to invest the loan to purchase more bags of charcoal and plastics to serve her customers. She anticipates increasing her profit level and also expanding her market.

Juliana is divorced and the mother of five children from age 6-22 years. She describes herself as hard working and resourceful mother who dreams of owning a shop and providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase 10 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Sagrado Corazón De Jesus Group

texts.es:
Las mencionadas mujeres son de la Compañía de la Ciudad de Caacupe.
Son Sras. que trabajan en su mayoría en la producción y venta de plantas en sus propios hogares, se dedican al cultivo y venta de plantas a gran escala, las señoras son de hogares muy humildes que con sus distintas actividades se ganan el pan diario para sus familias.
Todas realizan actividades muy sacrificadas una de ellas es la señora Salvadora Monzón quien también se dedica a la venta de plantas, ella y su marido trabajan todos los días por las planta que una vez que este en buenas condiciones para la venta salen por distintas ciudades para ofrecer sus plantas.
Es un trabajo muy pesado pero gracias a mismo sus hijos pueden estudiar y no les falta   nada. Ella desea aumentar su venta y producción para realizar algunas mejoras a su vivienda.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de semillas, abonos, y bolsas para macetas.
Todas las integrantes están muy agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya por tan importante oportunidad que les  brinda para poder aumentar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The women mentioned in this description belong to a group in the city of Caacupe. Most of these ladies grow plants on a large scale at home and sell them. Through their different activities, these humble women earn the income they need every day to support their families. All of them have made sacrifices in order to run their businesses.

One of these women is Sra. Salvadora Monzón, who sells plants. She and her husband work with plants all day to provide them good conditions so that they can be sold in different cities. The work is very tiring, but it has enabled her to provide her children an education so that they lack nothing. Salvadora wants to increase her sales and production, as well as make a few improvements to her home. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, compost, and bags for lining flowerpots.

All of the members are grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for providing an important opportunity for them to improve their income and quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds, compost, and bags for lining flowerpots

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es: Florinda, de 25 años, vive  en su casa propia, junto a su esposo Jhonny (32), y sus  3 hijos.Desde hace 8 años, se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas oriundas de esta parte de la selva. Lo que más le gusta es encajonar las frutas, porque puede seleccionarlas, de acuerdo al tamaño y color; sin embargo le disgusta comprarlas de las mismas chacras porque le resulta difícil trasladarlas, hasta su negocio. Paralelamente a este negocio también se dedica a la comercialización de productos de belleza, de diferentes marcas solicitadas entre sus conocidos y vecinos. Los negocios que tiene Florinda, son bastante rentables, porque le permiten brindar a sus hijos una adecuada calidad de vida. Actualmente esta adecuando un espacio en su casa, donde piensa instalar una tienda de venta de abarrotes. Además con las ganancias de las ventas de estos enseres, para más adelante, ya tiene planeado construir una vivienda más amplia para instalar  una ferretería.Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y esta gustosa de laborar en su banco comunal, de manera activa, porque los demás integrantes  son responsables, unidos y emprendedores como ella.El dinero que solicita lo invertirá, en la compra de mayor cantidad de frutas para que pueda continuar distribuyendo, y espera tener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Florinda is 25 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Jhonny (age 32) and their three children. For the past eight years, she has been buying and selling fruits native to this part of the jungle. What she enjoys most is boxing her fruits because she is able to select the ones she wants to sell based on size and color. However, she dislikes buying the fruit directly from the producer’s fields because it is difficult to transport them to her business.

In addition to this business, Florinda sells beauty products of different brands that are requested by her acquaintances and neighbors. Her businesses are quite profitable because they allow her to provide her children an adequate quality of life. She is currently remodeling a space in her house so that she can open a grocery store and already has plans to build a bigger house so that she can open a hardware store.

This is the sixth time she has received a loan from MFP. Florinda enjoys working with her Communal Bank as an active participant because the other members are just as responsible, close-knit, and enterprising as she is. The money she requested will be used to buy a large quantity of fruits so that she can keep distributing them and earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a large quantity of fruits to sell

loans.name: Akouavi Claudine

texts.en:
Madame Akouavi S. is 40 years old and owns a general store in her home town of Lomé, Togo. She's had her store for about two years. She is married to a taxi driver and they have three children.

Madame S. has requested a loan to purchase more merchandise for her store. This 300,000 CFA loan will fortify her working capital and allow her to buy more products that her clients request.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Gift Women's Group, Kayunga

texts.en:
33-year-old N. Harriet has this likable aura around her that she has used to her advantage in her seven-year-old retail business in Nazigo, Kayunga. The fact that she strikes such a nice chord with people also played into her hands earlier on when her husband gave her startup capital. She did not need too much to prevail upon power; all she did was just be herself, that cheerful and humorous character, and it won her laurels.

Today, this happily married mother of five is driving a roaring trade in her business, courtesy of her good-humored and easily-approachable nature. In her retail business, she has satisfactory rates of profit margin. At present, she makes weekly profits totaling up to 150,000 shillings.

With this loan, Harriet is looking at restocking her retail outlet with an array of purchased goods such as basins, cups, sugar, and shoe polish.

loans.use: To purchase more basins, cups, sugar and shoe polish to sell

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.en:
Monsieur Yaovi A. is a 27-year-old man who owns a stall selling second-hand clothing. He buys and sells his items in the capital city of Lomé.

As an ambitious young entrepreneur, he is successfully growing his business and, to do so, is taking his second micro-loan from WAGES. This loan of 350,000 CFA will be used to purchase more second-hand clothing and other items as needed.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothing and other items

loans.name: Odilonia Yarati

texts.es:
La Srta. Odilonia Yarati es soltera, vive en casa  de sus padres donde posee una despensa bien surtida, con este negocio ella los mantiene ya ellos estan están al cuidado de ella.
Ella esta muy satisfecha con su negocio y desea ampliar para aumentar sus ingresos, para ello solicita a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva un crédito para la compra de mercaderías en general para su despensa  así como fideos, harina, arroz, azúcar, golosinas, enlatados, panificados.
texts.en:
Odilonia Yarati is single and lives in her parents' home where she has a well-stocked store. She takes care of her family with this business as they are under her care. She is very satisfied with her business and wants to expand to increase her income. Thus, she is requesting a loan from Fundacion Paraguaya and Kiva to purchase merchandise for her store such as pasta, flour, rice, sugar, candy, canned items and baked goods.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of flour, candy, baked items, dairy items, canned goods, candy, rice, oils, vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es una madre D. familia D. 65 años D. edad que vive junto a sus tres hijos en el distrito agrícola D. Cayaltí, un distrito que ha experimentado un creciente desarrollo comercial en estos últimos años, la zona se encuentra ubicada a una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Trabaja ofreciendo productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio desD. hace mas D. tres años, este negocio es D. mucha importancia para la economía D. su familia por lo que siempre trata D. mantenerlo ofreciendo productos D. calidad y un buen trato a sus clientes, actualmente tiene un grupo D. clientes fieles que siempre recurren a su negocio para adquirir productos D. consumo diario.

Hilda desea seguir creciendo como empresaria adquiriendo más porductos para aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le sean D. ayuda para lograr sus metas.

Hilda es una mujer amable y trabajadora. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. realizar sus pagos.
texts.en:
Hilda is a 65-year-old mother who lives with her three children in the agricultural district of Cayaltí, which has been experiencing a growing commercial development over the past few years. The area is located about an hour from the city of Chiclayo. Hilda has maD. a living offering primary-need products and other groceries from a convenience store she runs out of her home for the past three years. This business if very important for her family's finances, so she always tries to offer quality products with good customer service. She currently has a group of faithful customers who always stop by her store to purchase their groceries. Hilda wishes to continue growing as a businesswoman by acquiring more products to increase her sales and profits, and she's requesting a loan of 1000 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa in order to achieve this goal. Hilda is a loving and hard-working woman who has previously worked with this institution and has shown herself to be punctual and responsible with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more products for her store

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo, tiene 45 años, está casado con Martha de 42 años, con quien tiene 5 hijos peor sólo comparte su vida en su casa propia con 3 de ellos, puesto que los mayores laboran de manera independiente y lo ayudan económicamente. Se le considera como uno de los mejores y grandes productores de piña de la selva central del Perú, actividad que empezó hace 4 años atrás. Paralelamente trabaja también como técnico mecánico de motos, pero por el momento cerró su taller, debido a que se cambio de dirección. Asimismo su esposa es docente de educación religiosa y labora en una institución de nivel secundario. Durante el tiempo que trabaja en el campo, reconoce que lo que más le gusta es mantener limpios sus surcos de piña para proporcionarle los nutrientes necesarios para desarrollarse, sin embargo el tener que pagar precios exuberantes para el traslado de sus productos hacía la capital, le parece demasiado. A pesar de eso, siempre obtiene ganancias que actualmente lo tiene ahorrado, ya que más adelante, aprovechando de su nuevo domicilio se encuentra ubicado en una zona turística, quiere instalar un restaurante, para administrarlo junto a su familia y así mantenerse unidos. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y ante los integrantes de su grupo comunal, se compromete a pagar puntualmente cada cuota. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico que esparcirá sobre sus cultivos, además contratará operarios para limpiar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 45 years old and he's married to Martha, 42, with whom he has five children. Only three of the kids live with them, and the older ones work on their own and help them financially. Alfredo is considered one of the biggest and best producers of pineapple in the central forest of Peru, which he has been doing for four years. Along with this, he also works as a motorcycle mechanic, but for the moment he had to close his workshop because he changed addresses. His wife teaches religious studies at a high school. During the time Alfredo works in the fields, one of the the things he likes best is to maintain clean rows of pineapple trees so they all receive the same amount of nutrients necessary for their development. However, he has to pay exuberant prices to transport his products to the capital, too much it seems to him. Despite this, he always is able to make a profit and now he has some savings so that in the future he can take advantage of his new home located in a tourist center and set up a restaurant that he can administer along with his family. This is the first time he has requested a loan from Kiva partner MFP, and he promises to be punctual with his payments. With the loan he is requesting, he plans to purchase various bags of organic fertilizer to spread amongst his crops as well as hire workers to keep his lands clean.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bags of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es: Bernardo, de 52 años, es un hombre trabajador que  vive en su casa propia, con su esposa Neria de (45), y sus 3 menores hijos de los 7 que tiene en total. Desde hace 27 años, todas las mañanas se despierta , con los primeros rayos del sol, prepara sus alimentos y se dirige junto con su esposa a cuidar adecuadamente sus plantaciones de plátano, café, frutas cítricas, yuca, maíz y carambola, que están en chacras arrendadas y propias. Los días que consideran de descanso los emplean en comprar y vender frutas al por mayor y menor, con la ayuda de sus hijos. A  Bernardo, le gusta tener siempre limpios sus cultivos, ya que asegura que de esa manera cosecha mejor; y para  mas adelante tiene planeado incrementar la cantidad de plantaciones de café, porque es un producto muy solicitado en los mercados y su precio por kilo oscila entre los 7 y 8 soles, por lo que considera que es un negocio bastante rentable.Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y le agrada trabajar en su banco comunal, porque puede compartir nuevas experiencias en cada reunión con los integrantes de su grupo, quienes son muy colaboradores.Bernardo tiene planeado invertir  el dinero solicitado en la compra de frutas por cosechar para que pueda venderlas, luego de encajonarlas, además piensa comprar varios sacos de abono para cuidar sus plantaciones de plátano.
texts.en:
Bernardo is a hard-working 52-year-old who lives in his own home with his wife Neria, 45, and their three small children, and he has seven overall. For the past 27 years he wakes up at the first light of morning and prepares some food and goes with his wife to care for their crops of bananas, coffee, citrus fruits, yucca, corn and star fruit, which are on land they lease and own. They use their days off to buy and sell fruits at retail and wholesale, with the help of their children. Bernardo likes to always have clean crops since they assure a good harvest, and for the future he plans to increase his coffee crops because it is a product in high demand at the markets and its price per kilo has fluctuated between 7 and 8 soles, so he considers it rather lucrative. This is the second loan he has requested from Kiva partner MFP, and he enjoys working with his community bank because he can share new experiences with his fellow group members, who are very collaborative, every time they meet. Bernardo plans to invest the money in the purchase of fruits to be harvested, which he can then package and sell. He also plans to purchase various bags of fertilizer to care for his banana crops.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and fertilizer

loans.name: Ayayi Same

texts.en: Monsieur Ayayi Same D. is a young computer technician. He is 24 years old and single and runs a business fixing computers and providing computer technology services in Lome, Togo. He has requested his first loan from WAGES of 300,000 CFA in order to purchase a laptop computer. This will make it easier to help his clients in the future when he is able to take his computer with him.

loans.use: To purchase a laptop computer

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María de 44 años, vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil, tiene una papelería (en ecuador se la llama “bazar”), desde pequeña ella se trazo de meta tener su propio negocio, pero por la falta de oportunidades no pudo hasta hace unos años atrás que invirtió sus ahorros en alguno artículos de papelería.

Cuando adecuo el pequeño local pudo tener la papelería que tanto había querido. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora ella tiene su papelería, y trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días.  

Vende también juguetes y ropa en su papelería.  Quiere comprar con el préstamo una fotocopiadora y artículos para la papelería y así darles mas opciones a sus clientes.

En el futuro quiere tener una línea de papelerías en todo el sector de la Perimetral.
texts.en:
María is 44 years old and lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil. She has stationery store (called a "bazar" in Ecuador). Since she was a young girl she wanted to have her own business, but because of a lack of opportunities she couldn't until a few years ago, when she invested her savings in some paper supplies. When she acquired a small storefront, she could finally have the business she always wanted. Since that time until now she has had her store, working from 9 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day. She also sells toys and clothes at her stationery store. With the loan, she wants to purchase a photocopier and paper supplies, thus giving her customers more options. In the future, she wants to have a chain of stores throughout the area.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a photocopier and stationery supplies

loans.name: Shabana Saleem's Group

texts.en: Shabana saleem lives in Multan the third largest city of Pakistan. She is a very caring lady. She supports her husband financially by working part time at her boutique — part time because she has to carry out her responsibilities of a mother and a wife as well. She is a talented lady. She prepares embroidered dresses and displays them in her boutique to attract customers. Her clientele base is made up of neighbors and her relatives. She has applied for a loan from Asasah (microfinance institute in Pakistan) because she wants to operate her business on a full-time basis. She will put a large variety of ready-made garments, clothes, and embroidered material at her boutique to attract the maximum number of clients. She is very hopeful about the success of her business.

loans.use: Purchase required material for boutique

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es: El solicitante se dedica a la actividad de venta de carne para el camal de Ica, comprando toros e invernando 60 a 90 dias, vende leche a la empresa de lacteos gloria encargandose su esposa netamente del recojo y venta. Solicita financiamiento para compra de alimentos para su ganado.
texts.en:
Carlos makes a living selling meat for the Ica slaughterhouse. He buys cattle and keeps them for two to three months. He sells milk to the dairy company. His wife, Gloria, is in charge of the pickup and sale. He is requesting the loan to purchase feed for his cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed for his cattle

loans.name: Fouzia Bibi's Group

texts.en: Fouzia bibi belongs to a poor family. She lives with her husband and family in a small house in Multan, Pakistan. She does embroidery work for her neighborhood clients. She is good at her work and wants to expand her business to gain maximum profit by using her technical abilities. She has applied for a loan from Asasah (microfinance institute in Pakistan). She will buy materials and an embroidering machine that will help her to do her job more efficiently than by hand. She is very  confident about her success as she has all the technical abilities related to her work.

loans.use: Purchase an embroidering machine and materials

loans.name: Juan De La Cruz

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan A. , es casado y vive en casa propia. 
El cuenta con una despensa que es uno de los fuentes de ingresos para familia, ademas trabaja en un tambo que tiene en su casa con criás y lecheras.
Se dedica a dichos rubros hace mas de 10 años,   ademas realiza ventas de verduras en su camioneta por los barrios aledaños a su domicilio.
A la fecha el señor Juan ha retirado solicitado el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para su negocio como arroz, enlatados, enbutidos, golosinas, frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
Juan A. is married and lives in his own house. He owns a store that is one of his family’s sources of income; he also works a dairy farm on his property where he has calves and dairy cows. He has been in these lines of work for over 10 years. He also drives his truck around the neighborhoods near his home selling vegetables. To date, Juan has taken out a loan to buy merchandise for his store such as: rice, canned goods, cured meats, sweets, fruits and vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits, vegetables, canned goods, cured meats, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: paying his second trimester fees in his 4th year at university

loans.name: Elvis Daniel

texts.es:
Elvis de 50 años de edad, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil,  es soltero con tres hijos ya mayores de edad. El presta su servicios de albañil recorriendo las calles de Guayaquil. 

Por la falta de oportunidades el tuvo que iniciar la actividad que le enseño su padre para poder mantener a sus hijos. Poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo comprar los materiales para ser un albañil preparado. 

Ahora el trabaja por contrato y tiene a su cargo personas que le ayudan.  La mama vive con el por eso el quiere mejorar su casa comprando con el préstamo materiales de construcción como cemento, piedras y bloques. 

Una de las cosas que quiere en su futuro es terminar de construir su casa y seguir ayudando a su mama hasta que Dios lo permita.
texts.en:
Fifty year-old Elvis lives in an urban area in the Guayaquil suburb. He is single with three adult children. He travels the streets of Guayaquil lending his bricklaying services. For lack of opportunities and to support his children, he had to start bricklaying, which his father taught him. Little by little and with effort and dedication, he was able to buy the materials he needed to become a professional bricklayer. Now Elvis does contract work and is in charge of people that help him. His mother lives with him, which is why he wants to improve his house. With the loan he will buy construction materials like cemement, rocks, and bricks. [He says that] one of the things he wants for his future is to finish building his house, and to continue helping his mother as long as God permits.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cement, rocks, and bricks to improve his home

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Madame Fati B. is 32 years old and married with five children. Her husband works as an exporter of goods. To supplement her family's income, she has been selling soap and other personal products in Lome's main market since 2003. She also sells her products throughout her own neighborhood. Madame Fati has requested her first microloan from WAGES of 150,000 CFA in order to purchase more merchandise to sell.

loans.use: To purchase soap and other products

loans.name: Elvis Arturo

texts.es:
Elvis tiene 18 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Nueva Arica, un distrito dedicado principalmente a actividades agrícolas como la ganadería y el cultivo de tabaco, se encuentra ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Trabaja desde hace un año preparando y vendiendo leche de soya, el prepara este producto todos los dias y lo vende muy temprano en su mismo distrito, sus clientes la adquieren para consumirla en el desayuno. Con las ganancias que percibe de este negocio el solventa sus gastos personales y ayuda a su familia con los gastos diarios.

Elvis gusta mucho de cocinar y prepara con buena sazón sus comidas, el desea valerse de esta habilidad para adquirir más ingresos y tener un negocio propio de venta de comida, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le permitan adquirir algunos utensilios para empezar a preparar menús y venderlos entre los vecinos de su distrito.

Elvis es un joven honesto y empendedor, sus vecinos le consideran una persona tranquila y que no gusta de hacer problemas. Su mayor anhelo es llegar a tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Eighteen year-old Elvis is single and lives with his parents in the Nueva Arica district, principally an agricultural district with activities like breeding and tobacco cultivation. It is located one and a half hours away from Chiclayo city. For one year Elvis has produced and sold soy milk. He makes this product every day and sells it very early where he lives. His customers buy it to drink for breakfast. With his earnings, he settles his personal expenses and helps his family with the daily expenses. Elvis really likes to cook and makes flavorful food. He wants to make use of this ability to increase his income and have his own food sales business. To realize his goal, he believes it is a good idea to get a loan of 800 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. This will allow him to get utensils to begin preparing food and selling it to his neighbors. Elvis is an honest and entrepreneurial young man. His neighbors consider him a calm person who does not like causing problems. His biggest desire is to have his own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of utensils to make and sell food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of potatoes, vegetables, and other ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Carlos Armando

texts.es: El solicitante vive junto con su esposa y sus 3 hijos, posse casa propia que es un modulo donado por la parroquia. Es chofer trabaja en carro alquilado recibe ingresos diarios su esposa trabaja por campañas en fundos de esparragos; actualmente tiene una bebita lo cual no le permite trabajar en los fundos. Solcita el credito para invertir en un negocio de venta de hamburguesas y venta de comida
texts.en:
The borrower lives with his wife and their three children. He has his own house, a unit donated by the church. He is a taxi operator and works in a rented car. He earns a daily income. His wife works for an asparagus farm, but currently has a little baby and is unable to work in the fields. He is asking for a loan to invest in a business that sells hamburgers and food.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business supplies

loans.name: Roukiya

texts.en: Madame Roukiya K. lives in her hometown of Lome and has a food stall where she sells rice, oil, and other general items. She is 42 years old and married with three children. She's had this business since 2006. Now, to expand her offerings and continue to satisfy her loyal clientele, she has requested her first microloan from WAGES of 400,000 CFA to purchase rice and oil.

loans.use: To purchase rice and oil

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora, de 43 años, vive en su casa propia, junto con su esposo Hugo (47) y sus 4 hijos, quienes son su razón de vivir, pues, como una buena madre siempre desea brindarles lo mejor.Se dedica a las labores agrícolas, cultiva café, plátano y palta, desde hace 5 años. Pero como la gran mayoría de días se encuentra en su casa, por atender a sus hijos, instaló ahí hace unos meses un negocio de venta de combustible (petróleo), en un espacio de su vivienda, de donde percibe ingresos económicos considerables. Mientras su esposo labora brindando servicio de movilidad,  trasladando personas a bordo de su auto propio, por ello ambos aportan para los gastos familiares. Y los fines de semana, junto a sus hijos y con operarios, se dirigen a limpiar y abonar sus plantaciones, pues asegura nunca las puede descuidar por que es una actividad muy rentable. Para más adelante quiere comprar más terrenos para incrementar su producción, también quiere ampliar su negocio convirtiéndolo en un gran establecimiento distribuidor de combustible.Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y se muestra muy entusiasmada, porque conoce la metodología de trabajo de su banco comunal, y le gusta mucho, porque aprende nuevas responsabilidades.Dora tiene planeado invertir  el dinero solicitado en la compra de  mayor cantidad de petróleo para dinamizar sus ventas y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
43 year old Dora lives in her own house along with her husband, Hugo, who is 47, and their four children, who are her reason for living. As she is a good mother, she always wants to be able to offer them the best. She has been working in agriculture for five years, growing coffee, bananas, and avocados. However, as she is at home most day looking after her kids, some months ago she started a business selling petrol from a space in her home. This has brought her considerable income. Meanwhile, her husband works offering transportation services, transporting people in his own car, so they both contribute to paying the family expenses. At the weekend, she and her children and some workers clear and fertilize her crops, and they never neglect to do this because it is a very profitable activity. In the future, she wants to buy more land to increase her production, and she also wants to grow her business by converting it into a major petrol supplier. This is the third time that she has had a loan from MFP and she is very enthusiastic about it because she knows how the community bank works, and she likes it very much because she learns new responsibilities. Dora plans to invest the requested money in buying a large quantity of petrol to boost her sales and so gain more income.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a quantity of petrol for her business

loans.name: Golden Temple Borrower Group

texts.en:
Petty trading like the sale of groceries is widespread in Ghana because the business is easy to start up. It usually begins with table-top selling and then grows to become a kiosk and eventually becomes a supermarket. 

Mary is one of such entrepreneurs who have been selling groceries like biscuits, bottled water, candies, canned foods, rice, cooking oil, toiletries, etc. for the past ten years. She currently sells out of a rented shop in her community market, hoping that, one day, she will be able to grow her business into a supermarket. She is excited to be taking out the loan which she plans to invest into purchasing groceries in bulk to serve her customers. She anticipates increasing her profit level and also expanding her market. She also sells used clothes to generate additional income.

Mary is a 49-year-old widow and she currently lives with one of her grandchildren who is 8 years old. She describes herself as a hard-working group leader of 'Golden Temple' Borrower Group, made up of seven members. She says her group members are cooperative and as the leader she ensures regular meeting attendance and repayment of loan installments.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Kitimbwa Twegatte Group, Kayunga

texts.en:
B. Johnson is a 39-year-old jovial and good-humored gentleman operating a boutique business in Kitimbwa in Kayunga. With his sense of business purpose, he has come a long way ever since he got established two years ago. This is all down to his inherent hard work ethic.

Kayunga is a vantage place for doing great business, especially if you are focused. Johnson has come to terms with that fact as he plies his business. As a manifestation of his good business fortune, all his three children, plus three dependents, are in well-to-do schools around Kayunga.

In a month, Johnson makes profits totaling up to 250,000 shillings and his future plans are to open up his own big shopping mall in Kayunga Town. The first step to making his dreams come to fruition is through the acquisition of this loan. He carries conviction that with this loan, he is going to be empowered to strengthen his boutique business. He is looking at purchasing new textile material for making clothes and also buying clothes that he hopes he will resell.

loans.use: To purchase new textile material for making clothes and new clothes to sell

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La Sra. Celia D. F.   es cliente recurrente, es casada, vive en casa propia y tiene 3 hijos. 
La misma cuenta con una despensa en su domicilio desD. el año 2000 contando con buena clientela a la fecha, dicho negocio son manejados por la Ella y su marido el Sr. Modesto F..
El préstamo que solicitó fue para la compra D. mercaderías para su negocio como panificados, enlatados, pastas, lacteos, embutidos.
texts.en:
Celia D. F. is a repeat client. She is married, lives in her own home and has three children. Since 2000, she has had a store in her home with good customers to date. She and her husband, Modesto F., manage the business. The loan that she asked for was for the purchase of items for her store, like dairy, baked and canned goods, pastas and sausages.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dairy, baked and canned goods, pastas and sausages

loans.name: Améleir

texts.en: Améleir A. E. Z. is 41 years old. She is married to a tax collecter in Lome, Togo, her hometown. They have five children together. In order to provide for her family, Améleir begain working as a seamstress out of her home nearly 10 years ago. She is now requesting her second loan from WAGES of 400,000 CFA to help her purchase more sewing supplies like fabrics, threads, and other items. This will serve not only as supplies she can use to make dresses but she can also sell them to her clients to make additional income.

loans.use: To purchase sewing supplies

loans.name: Zoila Isabel

texts.es:
Zoila de 64 años, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil, ella vende hace 10 años bebidas gaseosas para mantenerse con su propio dinero. Por la desesperante idea de tener su propio negocio inicio comprando bebidas a la distribuidora de coca cola. 

Poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación obtuvo clientela para venderles a sus clientes. Trabaja desde las 09h00 hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. Cada bebida la vende a $ 0.30, desde la mañana comienza a repartir las bebidas hasta las 20h00 . Ella quiere vender en su casa las colas pero para eso necesita comprar con el préstamo mas colas.    

En el futuro quiere tener su propio deposito de bebidas para asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Zoila, 64, lives in El Suburbio, Guayaquil. For 10 years she has sold soft-drinks in order to earn money to support herself. She was desperate to have her own business so she started out buying soft-drinks from the Coca-Cola distributor. Little by little with effort and determination she acquired regular customers. She works from 9am until 10pm every day. Each drink is sold for $0.30. She starts out selling in the morning and goes until 10pm. She wants to sell the colas in her home but to do so needs a loan with which to buy more colas. In the future, she’d like to have a beverage warehouse to assure her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For beverages.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es: Liliana, de 42 años, es una mujer honesta que vive con su esposo Daniel (38), ambos tienen 4 hijos y juntos habitan  en la casa de su cuñado, pues cuidan  la infraestructura.Anteriormente vendía combustible (petróleo), en un espacio de su casa, pero al no ofrecer medidas de seguridad para su familia y sus clientes, por ser inflamable, decidió cambiar de negocio. Es así que desde hace un año vende golosinas, cervezas y bebidas gasificadas, mientras su esposo labora en el terminal terrestre de la ciudad brindando el servicio de transporte. Lo que más le gusta es atender de manera esmerada a su clientela, que siempre la visita, ya que su establecimiento está ubicado en una zona bastante turística, que empieza a promocionarse y sabe que más adelante contará con mayores utilidades de las que percibe en la actualidad, por eso quiere complementar su negocio ampliándolo hasta instalar un restaurante.Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está contenta de seguir contando con la confianza de los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes son personas muy responsables y colaboradoras.Liliana tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de  varias cajas de cerveza y gaseosa que necesita para surtir su negocio, pues  tiene mayores ingresos durante los fines de semana.
texts.en:
Liliana is 42 years old. She is an honest women who lives with her husband Daniel (aged 38). They both have 4 children and live together in her brother-in-law's house, in exchange for taking care of its maintenance. She used to sell fuel (petrol) from a space in her house, but since this was dangerous for her family and customers due to it being flammable, she decided to change business. She has now been selling sweets, beers and soft drinks for the past year, whilst her husband works in the city's bus terminal, in the transport industry. What she most enjoys is offering a very attentive service to her regular customers who continue to visit her, since her establishment is located in quite a tourist area. She is starting to promote herself and she knows that in the future she will make more profit than she is currently seeing, so she wants to complement and expand her business by setting up a restaurant. This is the second time she has had a MFP loan and she is happy that the members of her communal bank continue to put their trust in her, as they are very responsible and collaborative people. Liliana plans to invest the money requested in the purchase of several crates of beer and soft drinks, which she needs in order to supply her business and increase her weekend income.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer to stock her business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca, de 52 años, es una madre de familia y ama el trabajo en el campo, está casada con Luis de 63 años, ambos tienen un hijo Jarol de 33 años, con quien vive en su casa propia. Mientras que su esposo labora como mecánico de aviación, ella, desde hace 15 años cuida con mucho amor sus cultivos de frutas cítricas, café y plátanos, que  con ayuda de operarios que contrato, le ayudan a dejar limpios sus plantaciones. Lo que más le agrada es cosechar sus productos, porque en ellos observa que valió la pena el esfuerzo que realizó en el campo. Además tiene terrenos cerca sonde cultiva naranjas, es así que logra cosecharlos para comercializarlos o para su propio consumo, sin embargo le resulta difícil encajonarlos para venderlos a los acopiadores de su ciudad o a los mayoristas del mercado. Manifiesta que gracias a la agricultura pudo obtener su casa propia, terrenos agrícolas y eso le ha permitido vivir sin preocupaciones, pero también, es conciente de que más adelante se conformará arrendando sus tierras. Es por ello que aprovechará un espacio que tiene en su domicilio para instalar una bodega, que este muy bien surtida de productos comestibles. Esta es la séptima vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y como presidente de la junta directiva de su grupo, hará que se respete los acuerdos tomados en las reuniones, Además sabe que sus compañeros son responsables y por eso le agrada laborar con ellos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, que esparcirá sobre sus cultivos para nivelar la producción.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 52 year old mother who loves working in the fields. She is married to 63 year old Luis, and they have a 33 year old son, Jarol. They all live together in their own house. Her husband is an aviation mechanic. For 15 years she has been lovingly taken care of her citrus, coffee, and banana crops. She has the help of workers that she hires to weed and take care of the crops. What she likes the most is harvesting her crops because she can see that her efforts in the fields were worthwhile. She also has fields nearby where she grows oranges. She harvests them to sell or for her own consumption. However, it is difficult for her to box them to sell to the suppliers or wholesalers at the market. She says that thanks to farming she was able to get her own house and land for farming. This has allowed her to live without worries. She is also aware that in the future she will adapt to renting her fields. That is why she will take advantage of a space she has in her house to set up a grocery store. It will be very well stocked with food. This is her seventh loan with MFP. As president of the governing board of her group, she will make sure that the decisions made in the meetings are respected. Also, she knows that her colleagues are responsible. That is why it pleases her to work with them. She will use the requested loan to buy various sacks of organic fertilizer to spread on her crops to level out the production.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Martha Azucena

texts.es:
Martha de 46 años, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil, tiene una papelería(en Ecuador se llama “bazar”) hace 5 años, como no tuvo oportunidad de tener su propio local tuvo que construir en la parte delantera de su casa un pequeño local para la papelería. 

Después de haber comprado cuadernos, papelería comenzó a venderlos en el local que había adecuado, poco a poco la surtió con mas artículos. Su hija de 15 años le ayuda hasta que se va en la tarde a la escuela. Trabaja desde muy temprano hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. Vende todo tipo de papelería también cosas para uso personal. Con el préstamo quiere comprar mas papelería y shampoo para su negocio. 

En el futuro quiere surtir mas su negocio y que sus hija termine los estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Martha, 46, lives in a suburb of Guayaquil. She has had a stationery store (in Ecuador it's called a "bazar") for 5 years. Since she has not had the opportunity to have her own location she had to build a small store in the front part of her house. After purchasing notebooks, she started to sell them in her location and bit by bit she stocked it with more items. Her 15-year-old daughter helps her until she goes to school in the afternoon. Martha works from very early in the morning to 10 pm every day. She sells all types of stationery and also personal use items. With the requested loan she wants to buy more stationery and shampoo for her business. In the future she wants to stock her business more and for her daughter to finish her studies with success.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stationery, shampoo

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.fr: A. Sylvie est née en 1962 à Tchaourou au Bénin. Depuis vingt six ans environs, Sylvie s'est installée au quartier Dodomey à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. Sylvie est une veuve, ayant quatre enfants, dont trois sont encore à sa charge. Tous les enfants de Sylvie sont scolarisés. Sylvie vit seule avec ses enfants et assure leurs différentes charges. Sylvie a arrêté les classes au cours secondaire. Pour faire face à ses besoins et répondre aux besoins de ses enfants, Sylvie mène comme activité la vente de produits divers (pâtes alimentaires, riz, bidons d'huile végétale, divers conserves, savons, etc.) à Allada. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Sylvie achète ses produits. Sylvie a obtenu une fois déjà de crédit auprès de ALIDé, et a bien effectué le remboursement. Sylvie désire augmenter davantage le volume de son activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle ; raison pour laquelle Sylvie sollicite un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
Sylvie A. was born in 1962 in Tchaourou, Benin. She has been settled for around 26 years in the Dodomey district of Allada in the Atlantique "département" (administrative region). Sylvie is a widow who has four children, three of whom are still in her care. All Sylvie's children are at school. Sylvie lives alone with her children and covers their various expenses. She left school at secondary level. In order to provide for her needs and those of her children, Sylvie has an activity selling a variety of products (pasta, rice, containers of vegetable oil, various conserves, soaps, etc.) in Allada. She buys her products at Dantokpa, Benin's international market. Sylvie has had one loan from ALIDé and repaid it correctly. She would like to increase the volume of her activity and better satisfy her customers; this is the reason she is requesting a second loan.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of five cartons of pasta and four sacks of rice

loans.name: Parfaite

texts.fr: A. Parfaite est née le 18 Avril 1977 à Allada, dans le département de l’Atlantique. Mariée à DAGNITO Jules, un instituteur, Parfaite est mère de trois enfants, dont seulement un est à sa charge. Il y a près de quatre ans que Parfaite s’est installée au quartier Gbowèlè à Allada, où elle vit avec sa famille. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la famille. Parfaite a très peu fréquenté l’école. Depuis sept ans environs, Parfaite mène comme activité la vente de chaussures sandalettes, de bols et de glacières en série, ainsi que de sucre en poudre à Allada. Parfaite s'approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Parfaite a bénéficié une fois déjà de crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Parfaite voudrait augmenter son fonds de roulement et augmenter le stock de ses produits, afin d'accroitre sa clientèle. C'est pour y parvenir que Parfaite sollicite un deuxième prêt.
texts.en:
Parfaite A. is born on April 18th, 1977 in Allada, in the Atlantique department. Parfaite is married to Jules DAGNITO, a primary school teacher, and is the mother of three children, of which only one is her dependent. Parfaite settled in the Gbowèlè neighborhood of Allada almost four years ago, and lives there with her family. The couple shares various family expenses. Parfaite didn't attend school for very long. For about seven years, she has run a business selling sandals, bowls and coolers as well as castor sugar in Allada. Parfaite gets her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has already benefited from an ALIDé loan, which she paid back without problem. Parfaite would like to increase her working capital and her product stock to grow her customer base. That is her objective in requesting this second loan.

Translated from French by Charlotte Buecheler, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sandals and bags of castor sugar

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Angostura en la provincia de Saylla departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra Brigida;  Nuestra socia tiene 40 años de edad, La socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos Nuestra socia alternando sus actividades del hogar se dedica a la administración de una granja, ella cría pollos, y otros animales como chanchos y cuyes para consumo  y para la venta al por menor. Nuestra socia es una mujer muy trabajadora ella también es agricultora y en Angostura tiene un terreno en el cual siembra papa, maíz y según la estación diferentes productos. La socia solicita el préstamo para utilizarlo como capital de trabajo.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the communal bank "VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA.” She lives in the Angostura district, Saylla province, and Cusco department.

Our member is named Mrs. Brigida. She is 40 years old, married, and has 4 children. She alternates between housekeeping and administering a farm. She raises chickens and other animals such as hogs and guinea pigs for consumption and for retail sale. She is a hardworking woman as well as a farmer. In Angostura she owns land where she grows potatoes, corn, and other products depending on the season. She requests the loan for the purchase of more materials.

She values and is infinitely thankful for the loan offered since this will allow her to grow her business and improve her standard of living. Likewise, she commits herself to repay the loan payments in the established periods.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of more materials.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 35 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Julio (35), con quien tiene 2 pequeños hijos.En  los terrenos que le heredaron sus padres, cultiva café, frutas cítricas y plátano, desde hace 15 años. Mientras su esposo labora como conductor de vehículos pesados en la municipalidad de la ciudad. Durante los fines de semana, ella y su esposo cuidan  adecuadamente sus plantaciones, y lo que más le gusta a Norma es cosechar, porque puede vender a buen precio los frutos que recolectó para volverlos a invertir nuevamente para mejorar su producción. Esta actividad le resulta muy rentable, porque puede solventar tranquilamente sus gastos, también puede vivir cómodamente y brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos, además de ahorrar para grandes proyectos futuros, pues confiesa que para más adelante, tiene planeado adquirir un fundo turístico y plantar mayor cantidad de  productos naturales que crecen en la selva central del Perú.Es  la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y dice  que le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal, porque ahorra  y aprende de las charlas educativas que le brinda esta entidad financiera.      Norma tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de  4 mil plantas de café y varios sacos de abono que necesita para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Norma, who is 35, lives in her own house with her husband Julio, 35, with whom she has two small children. For 15 years she has cultivated coffee, citrus fruits, and bananas on the land she inherited from her parents. Meanwhile, her husband works as a driver of heavy vehicles for the city. During the weekends, she and her husband provide appropriate care for her plantings. What Norma likes most is harvesting, because she can sell the fruits that she gathers at a good price, which she can reinvest to improve her production. This activity is very profitable for her, because she can pay her expenses without any worry, and she can also live comfortably and offer the best to her children. In addition, she can save for big future projects, since she confesses that in the future, she is planning to acquire a rural property and plant a larger quantity of natural products that grow in the central jungle of Peru. This is her third loan with MFP, and she says that she likes to work with her community bank because she saves and learns from the educational talks that this institution offers. Norma plans to invest the loan in the purchase of four thousand coffee plants and a number of sacks of fertilizer which she needs to improve her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy plants and fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
El comité La Amistad del barrio Yka´a de la Fracción Las Abellanas de la ciudad de Luque, se formó gracias a que señoras de otro grupo de un barrio vecino, les habían comentado a las mismas sobre el programa del comité e invitaron a que formaran un nuevo comité en esa zona. 
Ellas están trabajando de forma unida para generar mas ingresos para sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Elva A. quién se dedica a elaboración de diversos tipos de  dulces gran cantidad.
 
Ella compra las frutas y prepara los dulces y luego recorre varios negocios donde ofrece sus productos. 
Además tiene un negocio donde vende juguetes, ropas, y utensilio para el hogar.
Ella es una señora muy trabajadora y mantiene a sus hijos de  la mejor manera posible.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de envases de diversos tamaños ya que desea envasar sus productos para una mejor presentación, y manejo de los dulces.
texts.en:
The community bank La Amistad, in the Yka´a neighborhood in the Las Abellanas section of the city of Luque, was formed thanks to women in another group in a neighboring part of the city, who told them about the community bank program and invited them to form a new group in their area. They are working in a united form to generate more income for their families. One of the members is Señora Elva A., who prepares different types of jams in great quantities. She buys the fruits and prepares the jams and then goes around to a number of businesses where they offer her products. In addition, she has a business where she sells toys, clothing, and household utensils. She is a very hard-working woman and provides for her children in the best way possible. She is applying for this loan to purchase containers of different sizes because she wants to package her products for better presentation and handling.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy plastic and glass containers of different sizes.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María de 36 años, vive en Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución) de Guayaquil, su casa es de caña y tiene dos hijos. 

Ella tiene una tienda de víveres, hace cinco años atrás llego de Imbabura con su esposo e hijos para vivir en Duran. Poco a poco comprando algunos víveres inicio con una pequeña tienda para poder solventar su hogar. Ahora ella tiene su tienda de víveres trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de su esposo.  

Pero para tener mas surtida su tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo enlatados, arroz, aceites para su tienda. 
En el futuro quiere construir su casa de cemento y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
María is 36 years old and lives with her two children in a house built from sugar cane stalks in Duran, on the outskirts of Guayaquil. Duran is now an urban area but was originally rural, with numerous hills, streams, and lakes. Although these are still present, the feeling of being in a natural environment is slowly disappearing. Five years ago, María and her husband and children moved to Duran from Imbabura. Little by little, she began to acquire merchandise and opened a small grocery store to help pay their household expenses. With her husband’s help, she now tends the shop every day. She would like to have more stock for her shop, so she will use the loan to purchase canned goods, rice, and oil. Her goal for the future is to have a cement house. She also wants her children to successfully complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Canned goods, rice, cooking oil

loans.name: Dokodji Christine

texts.fr: Née en 1963 à Allada dans le département de l'Atlantique, S. Dokodji Christine est mariée à GNASSA Calixte, un menuisier. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille s'est installée au quartier Gbowèlè à Allada, depuis cinq ans environs. Christine contribue aux dépenses familiales, grâce au revenu que lui génère son activité. Christine n'a pas été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Christine vend divers produits (liqueurs, tissus, sous-vêtements, etc.) à Allada. Christine achète ses produits à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Christine exerce cette activité depuis quinze ans et a déjà obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. La demande en tissus de sa clientèle ne cesse de croître et Christine n'arrive plus à tous les satisfaire vu le nombre limité de ressources dont elle dispose. C'est donc pour renforcer son activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle que Christine sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1963 in Allada in the Atlantique department, Dokodji Christine S. is married to Calixte GNASSA, a carpenter. The couple has four children, all of whom attend school. The family settled in the Gbowèlè district of Allada about five years ago. Christine contributes to family expenses, thanks to the income generated by her business. Christine did not go to school. In order to meet her needs, Christine sells various products (liqueurs, fabrics, underwear, etc.) in Allada. Christine purchases her products in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Christine has been in this trade for fifteen years and has already received a loan from ALIDé which has been entirely repaid. Christine can no longer satisfy rising customer demand for fabrics, given the limited resources that she has. Christine has therefore requested another loan from ALIDé in order to boost her business activities and meet her customers’ needs.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 pieces of fabric

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Mórrope, una zona caracterizada por tener  la mayor parte de su población ubicada en áreas rurales que distan mucho una de la otra, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace varios años a vender pescado fresco en el mercado de su distrito, los ingresos que esta actividad le brindaba los invirtió en la instalación de una bodega en su domicilio, este negocio le brinda ingresos permanentes, ya que la venta de pescado se realiza por temporadas. Carmen da lo mejor de si a diario para mantenerse en el negocio y sacar a su familia adelante, para ello brinda productos de buena calidad y un buen trato a sus clientes.

Carmen desea adquirir mas productos para aumentar el inventario de su bodega, de este modo planea aumentar sus ventas y conseguir mayores ganancias, para alcanzar su meta ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Carmen es una mujer emprendedora y muy entregada a su familia, ella desea ir repotenciando su tienda para asegurarse las ganancias que le permitan brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y una buena educación a sus hijos. En la zona donde vive es bastante conocida y estimada por sus vecinos y clientes.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is 37 years old, married and has two children. She lives with her family in the district of Mórrope, a zone known for having the majority of its population in rural areas very distant from each other. It is part of the province of Lambayeque and is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Carmen made a living for a number of years selling fresh fish in her district's local market. She used the income she made to install a convenience store in her home. This business provides her with permanent income, since selling fish was only seasonal. Carmen gives her best every day to maintain the business and make headway for her family, providing quality products and good customer service. She wishes to acquire more products to increase her store's inventory, and in this way increase her sales along with her profits. To reach this goal she is requesting a loan of 1000 from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa for the first time. Carmen is a enterprising woman who is very devoted to her family. She wants to continue replenishing her store to ensure her profits, which allow her to provide her family with a better quality of life and a good education for her children. She is well known in her area and held in esteem by her neighbors and customers.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grocery supplies to expand her business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca tiene 42 años, casada con Luis Enrique de la misma edad, ambos tienen 3 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con uno ellos, en su casa propia, pues los mayores estudian en la ciudad de Lima, en busca de un adecuado nivel académico. La necesidad de ayudar a su familia a tener más ingresos en su casa, la empujó a vender a dulces, galletas, caramelos, bebidas gasificas y productos de primera necesidad. Mientras su pareja trabaja como técnico en mecánica en un asentamiento minero, él, cubre los gastos domésticos y la educación de sus hijos, pues el trabajo que realiza le es rentable. De igual manera el negocio de Francisca, le permite tener una vida cómoda y sin preocupaciones, a ella, no le incomoda despertarse todos los días muy temprano porque está segura que todo sacrificio tiene su recompensa, esto lo ve en las ganancias que recibe. Ahora espera ahorrar lo suficiente para adquirir un puesto en el  mercado modelo de la ciudad de “San Ramón”, donde piensa vender carne o productos comestibles al por mayor y menor. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y se siente orgullosa de ser parte de un grupo muy bien organizado, que le gusta ahorrar y estar pendiente de cada uno de sus integrantes y de su progreso. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería como productos de primera necesidad y perecibles, para dinamizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Francisca is 42 years old and married to Luis Enrique, also 42. Together they have three children, only one of whom lives with them in the home they own. The eldest ones are studying in the city of Lima in search of a higher education. The necessity of helping her family increase their income pushed Francisca to start selling candies, cookies, caramels, soft drinks and products of primary need. Her husband works as a mechanics technician at a mining plant, covering household expenses and their children's education, so his job is lucrative. Equally, Francisca's business allows them to live comfortably with out worries. It doesn't bother her that she wakes up early every day because she's sure that all her sacrifices will be rewarded in the profits she makes. Now she hopes to save enough to acquire a post in the main market in the city of San Ramón, where she plans to sell meat and other food products at retail and wholesale. This is the third time she has requested a loan from Kiva partner MFP, and she feels proud of being part of a very well-run group that likes to save and cares about every one of its members and their progress. With the loan she is requesting, Francisca plans to purchase a larger quantity of merchandise such as primary-need and perishable items to stimulate her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various products to better stock her store

loans.name: Jennifer Johanna

texts.es:
Jennifer de 25 años, vive en Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución) de Guayaquil, ella reparte almuerzos a casi todo el sector de Duran. 

Ella desde muy joven empezó a estudiar y como era una niña muy aplicada la becaron en la universidad, al pasar el tiempo ella recibió un premio en dinero por su buen desempeño académico, y lo invirtió en alimentos para hacer su propio negocio. Desde ese tiempo ella tiene un servicio de almuerzos a domicilios, ella mismo hace la comida y la reparte. Tiene un promedio de almuerzos diarios entre 120 / 150. 

Pero como ella cocina en su casa no tiene oportunidad de cumplir con todos los pedidos que le piden sus clientes por eso con el préstamo ella quiere comprar una cocina industrial. Y en el futuro quiere continuar con su negocio de comidas a domicilio.
texts.en:
Jennifer is 25 years old and lives in Duran (a suburban area with various hills, streams and lakes that still exist as remnants of an ecology in dissolution) in Guayaquil, Ecuador. She delivers lunches to almost everyone in Duran. She started studying at a very young age and as she was a very talented little girl, she was awarded a scholarship at the university. Over time she received a cash award for her good academic performance, and she invested it in foods to start her own business. From that time she has had her lunch delivery service, which she herself prepares and distributes. She averages between 120 and 150 lunches a day, but because she prepares the meals at her home, she doesn't have a chance to fulfill all of her customers orders. For this reason, she wants to purchase an industrial kitchen. In the future she wants to continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an industrial kitchen

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia, de 24 años, vive en una casa alquilada al lado de su pareja Ramón (31) y de sus dos pequeños hijos.Desde hace 4 años, cultiva papa, alverja, maíz, habas y verduras, junto con su esposo, en sus terrenos propios y arrendados, en tiempo de cosecha obtiene regulares ganancias de la venta de sus productos. También cría  animales menores como gallinas, cuyes  y cerdos, que utiliza para consumo familiar, también los vende cuando necesita cubrir algún gasto doméstico. Lo que más le gusta es vivir en la chacra y disfrutar de la tranquilidad del campo, sin embargo le disgusta regar durante la noche sus sembríos. El objetivo de esta joven pareja es brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos, por eso evitan que les falte algo, y como Cecilia, sabe que sus cosechas serán bastante productivas, las cuida adecuadamente. Para mas adelante piensa sembrar mayor cantidad de  productos que se desarrollan en esta parte de la sierra central.Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y  confía en que pagará puntualmente cada cuota, porque considera que es la única manera de demostrar el agradecimiento que tiene con la entidad, además porque quiere continuar en su banco comunal donde le gusta laborar.Cecilia tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  2 toros pequeños, los cuales ensebará para luego venderlos a mayor precio y así obtendrá mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 24 years old. She lives in a rented house along with her partner Ramón (31) and their two small children. For the past four years she has been growing potatoes, peas, corn, lima beans and vegetables along with her husband on their own land and land that they rent. During the harvest period they have regular earnings from the sales of their products. They also raise young animals such as chickens, guinea pigs and pigs that they use for food. They also sell these animals in order to cover household expenses. What they like the best is to live among the fields and enjoy the tranquility of the countryside. Never the less, Cecilia doesn’t like to water her crops at night. The goal of this young pair is to provide the best for their children. They try to provide for their needs and know that they need an adequate harvest in order to do so. In the future they hope to grow more crops that can be developed in the central mountains. This is the sixth loan they have requested with MFP. They are confident they can make the payments on time. They consider timely payments the only way they can show how grateful they are to have this entity. They hope to continue working with the community bank. Cecilia plans to invest the loan money in the purchase of two small bulls. They will raise them in order to sell them for a greater price and therefore have more resources.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy two young bulls

loans.name: Célia

texts.fr: D. Célia est née le 25 Juin 1980 et est mariée à ADJOVI Jean, un menuisier. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Tous les enfants sont encore à leur charge. La famille vit depuis près de quatre ans au quartier Dogoudo à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. Célia assure avec son mari les différentes charges familiales. Célia n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Célia vend de la nourriture (riz accompagné d'oeuf et de poissons, etc.) et divers autres produits à Allada, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens. Célia s'approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin et aussi à Allada. Célia exerce cette activité depuis huit ans et a obtenu trois fois déjà de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Célia a bien remboursé ces trois crédits. Dans le but d'agrandir son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Célia sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un quatrième prêt.
texts.en:
Célia D. was born on June 25, 1980 and is married to Jean ADJOVI, a carpenter. The couple has three dependent children and several are in school. For nearly four years the family has lived in the Dougoudo neighborhood of Allada, in the Atlantic Department. With her husband, Célia supports the family. Célia only attended elementary school. She sells food (rice accompanied with eggs and fish, etc.) and various other products in Allada, which enables her to provide for everyday necessities. Célia gets her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, and also in Allada. She has engaged in this activity for eight years and has already received three loans from ALIDé. Célia has fully repaid these three loans. Célia is asking for a fourth loan from ALIDé in order to expand her business and to better meet customer demand.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, eggs and sauce ingredients

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama I. prepares millet porridge and sells by moving from one house to another in and around Abura. She also sells salted fish under a shade in front of her house.

Mariama has received senior high education and is married to a security man. She has two children. She supports her husband in providing the basic needs of the family.

Mariama’s loan will be used to buy more millet for her porridge and more salted fish to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help take care of her children.

loans.use: To buy more millet for her porridge and more salted fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of 3 fields of manioc.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth, de 20 años, vive en una casa alquilada junto con su pareja José Luis (24) y su pequeña  hija Analí.Todos los días vigila junto con su esposo desde muy temprano sus siembras de papa, alverja, habas, maíz y diferentes verduras. Ambos llevan en esta actividad 3 años, y las técnicas agrícolas, las aprendieron de sus padres, quienes crecieron en las tierras que ahora les heredaron. También cultivan chacras arrendadas, para producir en mayor cantidad sus productos. Ella prefiere  cosechar tubérculos (papa), pues le gusta recogerlos entre los surcos, para luego comercializarlos en el mercado de la ciudad, donde ya tiene clientes conocidos por la calidad de sus cosechas, pero lo difícil es trasladar su producción hasta el punto de venta, por lo pesado que son los sacos. Las ganancias que perciben en su actividad, las invierten  y hasta pueden ahorrar, además para más adelante, desean  construir su propia casa, y  adquirir más tierras productivas.Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y se muestra muy entusiasmada de continuar laborando en su banco comunal, porque le gusta la buena organización con la que trabaja cada integrante.Ruth tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  10 sacos de guano, para sembrar sus tubérculos con éxito.
texts.en:
Ruth, who is 20 years old, lives in a rented house with her partner José Luis (24) and their young daughter Analí. Every day she looks after their crops of potato, peas, beans, corn and other vegetables from the early hours with her husband. They have been doing it for 3 years, after having learnt the agricultural techniques from their parents, who grew up in the fields they have now inherited. They also farm in leased farmland to produce more. She prefers growing tubers (potatoes) as she enjoys harvesting them from the furrows in the land and then selling them in the city market, where her clients know her for the quality of her crops. However, it's difficult for her to move her produce to the point of sale because the bags can be heavy. They invest their business benefits and even get to save for the future, when they hope to build their own home and buy more farmland. This is the sixth time she applies for a MFP loan, and she is enthusiastic about continuing to work with her loan group because she likes the fact that all members are well organized. Ruth plans to invest the money requested in the purchase of 10 bags of guano to sow tubers successfully.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy guano for her crops

loans.name: Elizabeth Maame Ama

texts.en:
Elizabeth Maame Ama is single and has been through junior high school. She sells cosmetics at Abura, which she has been doing for some time now. She uses her income to pay for her accommodation and utility bills.

Elizabeth Maame Ama will use the loan to purchase a variety of cosmetics to sell. The new revenue she expects to get as a result of the loan will be used to rent or buy a shop to sell in.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene una hija menor de edad, vive en casa de unos familiares ubicada en el sector Nuevo San Lorenzo del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, el distrito con mayor población de la región, es a su vez el distrito que tiene mayores índices de pobreza, se caracteriza por su elevado movimiento comercial ya que el mercado mayorista de la región se encuentra ubicado allí.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a la venta ambulante de golosinas y gaseosas en un terminal terrestre ubicado en la zona. Ella ofrece sus productos a los transeúntes de la zona y a los transportistas que cubren las rutas que unen a la ciudad de Chiclayo con los distritos alejados de la provincia de Lambayeque. Este negocio es su unica fuente de ingresos, por lo que trata de mantenerse de la mejor manera posible, ofreciendo un buen trato a sus clientes y dándoles productos de calidad.

Elena desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que sus ventas puedan incrementarse y perciba mayores ganancias con las cuales pueda adquirir un nuevo cochecito para mostrar sus productos. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1900 nuevos soles.

Elena es una mujer amable y alegre, anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Elena is 30 years old, is a single mother, and has a young daughter. She lives in the home of some relatives in the Nuevo San Lorenzo area of the José Leonardo Ortiz district, the district with the highest population in the region. It is at the same time the district with a high poverty level. It is characterized by its high commercial activity, since the region’s wholesale market is located there. For ten years, Elena has been a sweets and soda pop street vendor in a bus station located in the area. She offers her products to the passers by, and to the transporters that cover the routes that unite the city of Chiclayo with distant districts in the Lambayeque province. This work is her only source of income so she tries to comport herself in the best way possible, offering good treatment to her clients and giving them quality products. Elena wants to develop her business by purchasing more products so that her sales will increase. She will use the sales to buy a new cart to display her products.
