To achieve her objective, she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1900 nuevos soles. Elena is an amicable and cheerful woman. In the past, she has worked with Nuestra Instituciíon and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility when it was time to assume her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products to stock her street vending business

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.es: Norma Luz S. D. G. D. 41 años D. edad, es una madre soltera, la cual es muy responsable y quien tiene como prioridad principal sacar adelante a sus dos hijas, una niña D. 7 y otra D. 15 años D. edad, las cuales se dedican a estudiar. Norma vive junto a sus hijas, en el municipio D. Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Ella posee una venta D. tortillas, en la cual se encarga D. elaborar cada mediodía y cada noche las tortillas. Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa D. habitación lugar en el cual sus hijas le ayudan a repartir las tortillas, sobretodo en los fines D. semana. Norma desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, ya que este brinda ganancias muy estables, lo cual le permite sostener a su familia, es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor, varios cilindros D. gas propano y cal, esto para elaborar mayor cantidad D. tortillas, sobretodo los fines D. semana que su demanda se incrementa debido a que muchas otras tortillerías están cerradas, lo cual Norma desea aprovechar al máximo ya que D. esta forma ella podrá obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan mejorar su estabilidad.
texts.en:
Forty-one year old Norma Luz S. D. G. is a single mother who is very responsible and whose priority is to raise her children. One is a seven year old girl and another is fifteen years old, they are both students. Norma lives with her daughters in the Ilopango municipality in the San Salvador department. She has a tortilla selling business, for which she is in charge of making tortillas every afternoon and night. Her business is located in her home where her daughters help her distribute the tortillas, especially on the weekends. Norma really wants to improve her business because it brings stable earnings that allow her to sustain her family. It is because of this that she is asking for a loan to at least be able to buy maíz in bulk, various canisters of propane gas and lime. This is so that she can make more tortillas, especially on the weekends when demand increases because a lot of other tortilla vendors are closed. Norma wants to take as much advantage of this as possible since this allows her to get higher earnings that will allow her to improve her stability.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of maíz in bulk and canisters of propane gas for her tortilla business

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Rita, tiene 35 años, está felizmente casada con Edwin de 47 años, ambos tienen 5 hijos y viven en una casa alquilada, muy cómoda y bien situada para la actividad que desempeña y que no le permitirían realizar en el centro de la ciudad. Buscando el bienestar de sus hijos,  Rita junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos, en un taller que queda al frente de su domicilio. De manera independiente, tiene un taller de elaboración de productos pirotécnicos que tienen mucha demanda en las fiestas patronales que se realizan en su ciudad. Por otro lado su pareja practica el oficio de músico, que también le resulta rentable y hasta le permite ahorrar ya que su fin es poder comprarse su casa propia y acondicionar un lugar para instalar un restaurante. Lleva 15 años dedicada a estas labores y asegura que gracias a esta actividad a sus hijos nunca les faltó que comer. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y está feliz de continuar laborando con los integrantes de su grupo comunal, quienes son personas muy solidarias, acogedoras y responsables. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará materiales para elaborar más juegos pirotécnicos.
texts.en:
Rita is 35 years old and happily married to Edwin, 47 years old. Together they have five children and live in a very comfortable rented home and well situated for the work that she does and that she would not be allowed to do in the center of the city. For the wellbeing of their children, Rita and her husband make bricks in a workshop that is in front of their residence. Independantly, she has a workshop for making fireworks, which are in high demand for the patron saint festivals that occur in her city. On the other hand, her spouse is a musician. This is also profitable and even allows her to save, since her goal is to buy her own house and to set up a restaurant. She has done all of this work for 15 years and it is thanks to these activities that her children never went hungry. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she is happy to continue working with the members of her communal group, who are very supportive, warm, and responsible. With the loan that she requests, she will buy materials to make more fireworks.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to make fireworks

loans.name: Honorine

texts.fr: Née en 1983 à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique, T. Honorine est mariée à KAMARA Razack et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Honorine vit ensemble avec sa famille au quartier Dodomey à Allada, depuis cinq ans. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la famille. Honorine n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour assurer ses besoins, Honorine vend des produits vivriers au marché de Allada. C'est au Borgou, dans le Nord du Bénin, que Honorine achète ses produits. Honorine exerce cette activité depuis trois ans. C'est la première fois que Honorine sollicite un crédit de ALIDé, en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1983 in Allada, in the department of The Atlantic, Honorine T. is married to Razack Kamara and is the mother of three children, all enrolled in school. Honorine has lived together with her family for five years in the Dodomey district in Allada. The couple works together to provide for the various needs of the family. Honorine only went to elementary school. To ensure her family's needs, Honorine sells food products at the market of Allada Honorine buys her products in Borgou, in the North of Benin. Honorine has carried on this activity for three years. This is the first time that Honorine requests a loan from ALIDE, in order to raise the level of her activity and to better satisfy the request of her customers.

Translated from French by Mark Latour, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products (sacks of beans, maize, dry peppers, etc.)

loans.name: Ama Fosty

texts.en:
Ama Fosty S. sells cooking utensils and plastic containers at Abura. She has received junior high education. She is a married woman with three children and her husband is a driver. She is responsible for helping her husband provide food, clothing and shelter for the family.

Ama Fosty’s loan will be used to buy extra cooking utensils and plastic containers to resell. She anticipates using the new profits to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more cooking utensils and plastic containers to sell

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es: Gonzalo H. de 59 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su grupo familiar el cual esta conformado por su esposa la cual trabaja vendiendo fruta en el mercado de Santa Tecla, y junto a sus dos hijos. Gonzalo se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, de forma ambulante, las cuales comercializa por diferentes colonias de Santa Tecla, día tras día Gonzalo trabaja con la ilusión de poder contar con más ventas, las cuales beneficien a su familia y así mismo su negocio, ya que esto le permite poder invertir un poco más en el. Es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con el monto de dinero necesario para poder comprar mayor variedad de frutas y verduras, y todas por mayor. Así mismo Gonzalo desea comprar huevos por mayor, esto con el fin de poder brindar más productos a sus clientes, ya que los huevos son muy solicitado, es por esto que desea invertir en estos, así de esta manera podrá ofrecerles a sus clientes un mejor servicio en el cual complazca todas las necesidades de ellos y de esta forma contar con toda la confianza de consumidores, lo cual se traduzca en más ventas para Gonzalo.
texts.en:
Fifty-nine year old Gonzalo H. resides in the Santa Tecla municipality, located in the La Libertad department. He lives with his family, made up of his wife, who works selling fruit in the Santa Tecla market, and his two kids. Gonzalo itinerantly sells fruits and vegetables, which he markets in different Santa Tecla neighborhoods. Day after day he works with the hope of counting more sales. This benefits his family and his business, since it allows him to invest a little more in it. This is why he asks for a loan, to have the money necessary to purchase more of a variety of fruits and vegetables, and by wholesale. Gonzalo also wants to buy eggs by wholesale with the goal of being able to provide more products to his clients, since eggs are in demand. This is why he wants to invest in eggs, so that he will be able to offer his clients better service. In this way, Gonzalo will fulfill all of their necessities and so count on the confidence of his customers, which will transform into more sales for him.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits, vegetables, and eggs by wholesale

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es: Ana Vilma G. de 60 años de edad, es una señora muy trabajador, la cual con muchos esfuerzos sacó adelante a sus hijos, los cuales todos son mayores de edad, y de los cuales solo una hija vive con ella, quien se dedica a trabajar y se ocupa de todos sus gastos personales. Desde hace 15 años que Ana Vilma posee un puesto en el mercado Dueñas el cual esta ubicado en el municipio de Santa Tecla, en el cual vende platillos típicos salvadoreños, tales como: plátanos en dulce de atado, una atol salvadoreño llamado “chilate”, el cual esta hecho de maíz tostado, y así mismo otros platillos como nuégados, los cuales son unas bolitas hechas de yuca y muchos otros alimentos más que son hechos de dulces, a pesar que únicamente el atol se llama chilate, las personas le llaman chilate también a todos los platillos mencionado anteriormente en una forma de generalizar, estos antojitos son muy solicitados, sobretodo cuando poseen un excelente sabor como los que elabora Vilma, quien tiene muchos años de experiencia lo cual le ha permitido ser muy conocida por esto en el lugar, por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes.  Ana desea poder invertir más en el negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de materia prima para elaborar mayor cantidad de platillos típicos y de esta forma mejorar sus ganancias y así mismo poder pagar todos los gastos de su casa en la que habita, la cual esta ubicada en Mejicados, en el departamento de San Salvador.
texts.en:
Sixty year old Ana Vilma G. is a very hardworking woman who after much effort raised her kids, now adults. Only one daughter is living with her, and she works and takes care of all of her personal expenses. For fifteen years, Ana Vilma has had a stand in the Dueñas market located in the Santa Tecla municipality. Here she sells traditional Salvadorian dishes, like plantains served in sugar cane honey, and a Salvadorian atol [a thick, masa based drink] called “chilate,” made of toasted maíz. She also makes other dishes like nuégados, which are little balls made of yucca, and many other foods that are made sweet. Since only the atoll is called “chilate,” people call all of the other dishes mentioned “chilate” to generalize. These snacks are very popular, especially when they have great flavor like the ones Vilma makes. She has many years of experience that have allowed her to become very well known in this place, where she has many customers. Ana wants to invest more in her business by purchasing larger quantities of primary ingredients to make more traditional plates. In this way, she will improve her earnings and at the same time be able to pay all of her household expenses. Her house is located in Mejicanos, in the San Salvador department.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of maíz, yuca, and sweets to make traditional dishes

loans.name: Jimmy Henry

texts.es: Jimmy Henry G. M. de 26 años de edad, posee un comedor en el cual elabora desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo por las noches elabora pupusas. Todo esto lo hace con la ayuda de su esposa quien le ayuda a preparar los alimentos, el trabajo que realiza lo elabora con el deseo de poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus dos hijos y así mismo contar con una vida estable. Su negocio esta ubicado a la salida del pasaje en el cual reside Jimmy, el cual esta ubicado en Soyapango, debido a que esta es una zona muy comercial ya que hay diferentes negocios, centros comerciales y fabricas, el cuenta con muy buenas ganancias diarias. Es por esto que solicita un préstamo a Integral a través del cual pueda invertir más en el comedor, comprando: verduras, bebidas, frutas, diferentes tipos de carnes, jugos, maíz, queso y otros ingredientes más, los cuales le den la oportunidad de elaborar más alimentos y más pupusas, las cuales son de los platillos que más se venden. Para Jimmy es de mucha importancia mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, ya que es este la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta para sostener su hogar y a su familia, es por ello que su mayor deseo es incrementar sus ventas y poseer más clientes y esto lo podrá lograr comprando todos los productos necesarios por mayor, de esta manera contará con los recursos necesarios para elaborar más comida.
texts.en:
Jimmy Henry G. M. is 26 years old, and has an eatery where he makes breakfast and lunch. He also makes pupusas at night. He does all of this with the help of his wife, who helps him prepare the food. He does all of this work in the hopes of providing for every necessity of his two children, and also to have a stable life. His business is located where Jimmy resides, at the exit of a narrow street in Soyapango. Since this is a very commercial area with many businesses, malls, and factories, he makes very good earnings daily. This is why he is asking for a loan from Integral, which will allow him to invest more in his dining room by purchasing vegetables, drinks, fruit, different types of meat, juice, maíz, cheese, and other ingredients. These will give him the opportunity to make more food and more pupusas, which sell the most. For Jimmy, it is very important to improve the condition of his business, since it is the only source of income that he has to support his home and his family. This is why his biggest hope is to increase sales and to have more clients. He can achieve this by purchasing all necessary products in bulk. In this way, he will have the necessary resources to make more food.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of primary ingredients to make meals and pupusas

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Las Mercedes del barrio Las Mercedes, se formo mediante el deseo de las integrantes de formar un grupo para trabajar con ayuda mutua entre las integrantes quienes se acercaron hasta la Fundación  para integrarse al programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, actualmente el comité se encuentra en el sexto ciclo y todas están muy satisfechas con los logros obtenidos mediante el comité.

La señora Petrona H. tiene  negocio donde ofrece todo tipo de productos de uso domésticos y actualmente quiere ampliar su negocio con la venta de ropas para ello solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropas para invierno como camperas, buzos, suéter, pantalones.
Ella está muy agradecida por el crédito que recibieron ya pudo invertir en su negocio y podrá aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Las Mercedes [The Mercedes Women] committee from the Mercedes neighborhood was formed due to the desire of the members to start a group with members that would work and help eachother. They approached Fundacíon Paraguaya to join The Committee of Entrepreneurial Women program. Currently, the committee is in its sixth cycle and all are very satisfied with the successes they have had. Petrona H. has a business that offers all kinds of household products. She wants to develop her business by selling clothes. For this she is asking for a loan to buy winter clothes like jackets, sweatshirts, sweaters, and pants. She is very grateful for the loan that the group has received, has already been able to invest in her business and will be able to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for the winter season, like jackets, pants, and sweatshirts

loans.name: Narciza Margarita

texts.es:
Narciza de 39 años, vive en Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución) de Guayaquil, su esposo es taxista con el tiene cinco hijos. 

Ella tiene un puesto de venta de tripita (llamado así en Ecuador porque son los intestinos de la vaca que los hacen como parrillada). Comenzó ayudándole a su prima en un puesto que ella tenia poco a poco con esfuerzo ella pudo tener su propio puesto de venta de tripita. Ahora ella trabajaba  desde las 15h00 hasta las 18h00pm todos los días con ayuda de un triciclo recorre las calle. 

Pero para tener mas efectividad en sus ventas ella quiere comprar con el préstamo otro triciclo para transportarse con mas cuidado y limpieza. E el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Narciza is 39 years old and lives in Duran, an urban area in Guayaquil. The area was originally uneven, with many hills, streams and lakes that exist as the remains of a dissolving ecology. Her husband is a cab driver and with him she has five children. Narciza has a stall where she sells tripe, called this in Ecuador because it is grilled cow intestines. She began by helping in her cousin's stall, and little by little, with effort, she was able to get her own stall selling tripe. Now she works from 3 to 6pm every day, with help from a tricycle that she drives around the streets. In order to be more effective in sales, she wants a loan to buy another tryicycle so that she can travel more carefully and neatly. In the future, she wants to finish building her home.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a tricycle to help improve her food sales

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Kuña Guapoa se conformó en fecha 9 de Marzo del 2.008, con mucho esfuerzo ya  se encuentran en el 5º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en grupo para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar económicamente  a sus familias en especial.
Una historia muy conmovedora  es la de la Sr. Hilda Mascaró quien se dedica a la venta de bijouterí, y solicitó el  crédito  mejorar bastante su  trabajo con la compra de materiales  que ella utiliza para fabricación de lo bijouteri.
 Ella       nos comenta que mediante este negocio la economía de la familia mejoró bastante ya que actualmente posee además del ingreso de su marido quien se dedica a la albañilería, con  el ingreso de su negocio.
 Según la Sra. Hilda  mencionó que las actividades que realizan con la Fundación Paraguaya son muy importantes ya que les ayuda desarrollar sus  capacidades de trabajo y autoestima.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapoa Women’s Committee was formed on March 9, 2008. After much effort they now find themselves in their fifth loan cycle, together and in solidarity in the program. In additon to their independent work, they also do group fundraising activities with the goal of saving some capital for the group. At the same time they help each other, especially in the objective of working to support their families economically. One touching story is that of Hilda Mascaró, who sells jewelry. She sought a loan to greatly improve her work by purchasing the materials she uses to make jewelry. She tells us that through this business, her family's financial situation improved a lot, now that she also has the income of her husband, who is a bricklayer, to add to hers. According to Hilda, the activities that the women do with Fundacíon Paraguaya are very important because they help them develop their job skills and self esteem.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of accessories for the production of jewelry (earrings, bracelets, chokers, purses)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of four cows for dairy production and breeding

loans.name: Aracelys Maribel

texts.es: A sus 23 años de edad la señora Aracelys Reyes, junto a su esposo ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida a trabajar como empleado en una compañía naviera en el país vecino de Costa Rica, en donde ella desempeña el puesto de mesera de un restaurante y su esposo como capitán de una embarcación dicha actividad económica de la empresa para la cual ellos trabajan es con destinos turísticos, actualmente este matrimonio ha decidido realizar la construcción de su vivienda ubicada en la comarca las mesitas sector casa blanca, en donde tienen el sueño de emprender un negocio he independizarse de su vida como empleados, por tal razón ellos solicitaron un crédito para poder terminar su casa y tener un mejor lugar donde habitar junto a su pequeña hija de 3 añitos de edad.
texts.en:
Aracelys Reyes, twenty-three, along with her husband, has spent most of her life working for a shipping company in the country neighboring Costa Rica. She works as a server in a restaurant and her husband is a boat captain. The company they work for serves tourist destinations. This couple has now decided to build their own house in the Casa Blanca sector of the Las Mesitas region, where they dream of launching a business to free themselves from their lives as employees. That's why they've asked for a loan, so they can finish up their house and have a better place to live with their little three-year-old daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is an experienced market vendor from the Kherson region. She started her small venture selling men’s and women’s footwear 15 years ago. Irina was struggling to survive and make both ends meet as most Ukrainians did in early post-soviet times. She tried her luck with a shoe sales business and it became quite a success. Presently, Irina has invested about 100,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her turnover capital amounts to 60,000 Grivnyas. 

Irina is divorced. She has a teenage son, Vladislav. She is the only breadwinner in the family at this point. Irina works hard to provide for her family’s needs and keep her business afloat in these difficult economic times. She is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase seasonal merchandise and re-stock it for summer.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Kuña Tory Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre  Kuña Tory, se conformó en fecha 28 de Octubre del 2.008, con mucho esfuerzo y esmero ya en el 3º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Catalina  S. quien se dedica al lavado de ropas para ayudar a su familia con los gastos, nos comenta que con el crédito pudo comprar pudo un lavarropas con el su trabajo se aliviana bastante además de lavar mayor cantidad de ropas.
 Ella       nos comenta que mediante este trabajo la economía de la familia mejoró bastante ya que actualmente posee además del ingreso de su marido quien se dedica a la pesca y venta de pescado.
texts.en:
The Woman's Committee named Kuña Tory was created on October 28th, 2008. Thanks to much effort, it is in its 3rd cycle. One of its members is Mrs. Catalina S., who works washing clothes in order to help her family with expenditures. With her previous loans Catalina was able to buy a washing machine, which saved her time and allowed her to wash more clothes. Catalina reports that, thanks to previous loans, her family is much better off and earns a higher income in conjunction with Catalina's husband's income from selling fish.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a washing machine

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara, de 41 años, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos pero sólo vive con la menor, puesto que su hijo mayor, trabaja de manera independiente en otra localidad, en busca de un futuro mejor. Anteriormente se dedicaba en la venta de prendas de vestir,  pero ahora se dedica a atender a la menor de sus hijas. Solo los fines de semana, trabaja en su pequeño puesto de venta de comida, en donde prepara diferentes tipos de  potajes al gusto de sus clientes. Lleva 7 años trabajando en varios negocios y siempre le ha resultado muy rentable. Disfruta mucho cocinar platillos típicos de la zona selva del Perú, es por eso que más adelante, quiere tener su propio restaurante, espacio que acondicionará dentro de su casa, asimismo desea reabrir una tienda de zapatos, zapatillas y prendas de vestir sencillas, para vender al por mayor y menor. Esta es la séptima vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y está contenta de laborar en su grupo comunal, porque le enseñan a ahorrar, además todos sus integrantes son muy responsables. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará los insumos necesarios para preparar comida.
texts.en:
Sara is 41 years old and a single mother of two children. Only the younger child lives at home, while the older child is currently working in another town in efforts to create a better future for herself. Sara used to work selling dresses, but now she spends her time taking care of her younger daughter. She currently works selling food during the weekends, and makes different stews for her customers. She has spent the past 7 years working in various businesses, which have always been profitable. She enjoys cooking typical rural Peruvian food, which is why she would like to have her own restaurant in the future. For this reason Sara would like to re-start selling shoes and dresses. This is her 7th loan with MFP, and she enjoys working with her communal group because they teach each other how to save and be responsible. With this loan Sara will buy ingredients necessary for her food.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and prepare food

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda, de 36 años, vive en una casa alquilada con su pareja José (40), y sus  2 pequeños hijos.Desde hace 2 años se inicio en el negocio de venta de productos de belleza; también alquila retroproyectores para cualquier evento que lo requiera, mientras su esposo labora como empleado en una empresa. Lo que más le gusta a Hilda, es recomendar que tipo de productos de belleza le favorecerán mejor a sus clientes, por otro lado, le molesta cuando confía en las personas y les da a crédito un producto y no le pagan en las fechas indicadas, por eso ahora vende mediante los catálogos. Esta segura que sus ganancias se duplicarán porque comprará perfumes y productos  a precio de promoción, para luego venderlos a precio normal de acuerdo a la campaña. Para más adelante, quiere instalar en la casa donde vive, un negocio de venta de cables de electricidad, toma corrientes, pues con el tiempo quiere convertirlo en una ferretería.Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está feliz de que la entidad financiera de su confianza haya apostado por la labor que emprende al facilitarle el préstamo.Hilda tiene planeado invertir el dinero  solicitado en la compra de  mayor cantidad de perfumes, en especial de varones, ya que se acerca el día del padre.
texts.en:
Hilda is 36 years old. She lives in a rented house with her spouse Jose (40), and their two small children. Two years ago, she started a business selling beauty products. She also rents out retro projectors for any event that needs them, while her husband works as an employee in a business. What Hilda likes the most is recommending what type of beauty product would most favor her customers. On the other hand, it bothers her when she trusts people and sells them a product on credit and they don't pay on the agreed upon day. That is why now she sells via the catalogs. She is sure that her earnings will double because she will buy perfume and products at a special price and later sell them at a normal price according to the sales campaign. In the future, she wants to have a business in the house where she lives selling electrical cables and sockets. In time, she wants to turn it into a hardware store. This is the first time that she has had a loan with MFP and she is happy that the financial entity is putting its trust in her and has bet on the work that she does to give her the loan. Hilda is planning on investing the money she has asked for in purchasing a greater quantity of perfume, especially for men, since father's day is coming.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Ines

texts.es:
Rosa de 47 años,  vive en Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución).  Su esposo es chofer ellos tiene un hijo. 

Ella comenzó desde joven a trabajar como costurera, poco a poco se compro una maquina de coser para comenzar a trabajar en su casa. Por la buena decisión que tomo ahora tiene tres maquinas de coser para hacer todo tipo de ropa,  trabaja desde muy temprano hasta que termina todo los pedidos, pero para tener mas facilidad para hacer la ropa ella quiere comprar con el préstamo una maquina industrial. 

En el futuro quiere tener otro negocio como un buffet de comida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 47 years old. She lives in Duran, a suburb that once had hills, creeks and ponds that can still be seen as the remains of an dissapearing ecology. Her husband is a driver and they have a child. She started as a young woman working as a seamstress. Little by little, she bought a sewing machine to start working at home. Because of that good decision she made, she now has three sewing machines to make every type of clothing. She works from very early until she finishes all the orders. To make it easier to make the clothes, she wants to buy an industrial machine with the loan. In the future, she wants to have another business, such as a food buffett.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Industrial Sewing Machine

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is married with two grown children. She lives in Novaya Kahovka. Nadezhda sells retail merchandise in one the local marketplaces in her home town. Her inventory includes socks, pantyhose, pareos, swimsuits and speedos. She has been in this business for 16 years. Currently, her turnover capital amounts to 15,000 Grivnyas. Net profit is 6,000 Grivnyas a month. Nadezhda has 24,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. 

Nadezhda is seeking a loan of 13,000 Grivnyas to purchase a variety of summer merchandise for this vending season. She is an experienced entrepreneur who knows the demand and uses her knowledge to attract more customers. Nadezhda says her business is the main source of income for her family which is why she works hard to keep it running efficiently and bringing in a stable income.

loans.use: to purchase summer merchandise

loans.name: Lidiya

texts.en:
Lidiya is a single mom who raises a son. She is a market-vending entrepreneur selling quality women’s footwear in one of the biggest markets of Zaporozhye called Angolenko. She has been in this business for twelve years. Presently, she has 59,000 Grivnyas in inventory and her gross turnover amounts to 17,000 – 20,000 Grivnyas. 

Lidiya is requesting a 9,000 Grivnya loan to purchase additional footwear merchandise for the summer season. She admits that her business has benefited a lot from lending services. She believes the current loan will give her business a good boost and help her generate additional income as a result.

loans.use: To purchase summer footwear for her business

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married with two grown children. She is an entrepreneur from Zaporozhye who sells bags, purses, wallets, backpacks, etc., in one of the local markets called “Krytyi” (“Covered”). She has been in this trade for twelve years. Currently, she has about 20,000 Grivnyas in inventory and her gross turnover amounts to 13,000 Grivnyas. She is seeking a 6,000 Grivnya loan to diversify her assorted merchandise.

Galina started her small vending business selling hair combs, small cosmetics gifts, and manicure sets. However, later, she decided to change the type of inventory she offers for sale and started selling purses and backpacks. She admits that she likes working with this merchandise because it sells well and is easily transported.

loans.use: To purchase summer merchandise for her business

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es: Zenaida, de 49 años, es una mujer ejemplar con ganas de salir adelante, es soltera, tiene 3 hijos, que laboran de manera independiente pero viven juntos en su casa propia. Se considera una madre de familia capaz de hacer cualquier oficio que se le encomiende, pues actualmente tiene un negocio de venta de comestibles, también posee un espacio para recreo turístico llamado “Los Girasoles” y lo abre todas las tardes. Como si eso fuera poco se dedica a la agricultura los fines de semana, tiene terrenos donde crecen frutos cítricos, que luego serian vendidos al por mayor. Lleva 25 años realizando estás actividades y lo que más le gusta es disfrutar de la tranquilidad que siente en la zona por donde vive, en estos años de experiencia sabe que sus actividades son bastante rentables, ya que le permitió construir su casa, cubrir la educación de sus hijos y vivir cómodamente sin pasar necesidades, además una de sus hijas estudio la profesión “Hotelería y Turismo”, por lo que piensan construir los terrenos vacíos que tienen e instalar un hotel, asimismo desea que una de sus hijas viaje al extranjero por motivo de trabajo, en busca de una calidad de vida mejor. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y como conoce a las integrantes de su grupo comunal, se siente en familia, ya que confía mucho en las socias. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varias cajas de cerveza y bebidas gasificadas para llenar su bar.
texts.en:
Zenaida, 49, is an exemplary woman with a strong desire to get ahead. She is single and has 3 children who work independently, but they all live together in her own home. She is considered to be a mother who can succeed doing any kind of task. Currently she has a business selling food. In addition, she has a recreation area for tourists called "Los Girasoles" which is open every afternoon. And as if this wasn't enough, she also works in agriculture on the weekends. She has lands where she grows citrus fruit, which she later sells wholesale. She has 25 years of experience in these activities, and what she enjoys most is to enjoy the tranquility she feels in the area where she lives. Through her years of experience she has found that these activities are quite profitable, since they have allowed her to build her house, pay for the education of her children and live comfortably with all the necessities. Also, one of her daughters studied in the "Hotel and Tourism" career, since she is thinking of putting a hotel on some vacant land that she has. She also wants one of her daughters to travel outside the country to look for work, so that she can search for a better quality of life. This is her 3rd loan with MFP, and since she knows the members of her communal bank she feels at home since she has a lot of confidence in her fellow members. With the loan she requests, she will buy a number a cases of beer and soft drinks to stock her bar.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to stock her store

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter, de 33 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Nelly (29), con quien tiene 4 pequeños  hijos.Desde hace 7 años, se dedica  a la siembra de papa, habas, alverja, maíz y verduras, pues esta actividad le ha permitido comprar sus terrenos, construir su vivienda y solventar las necesidades de su familia. Cada mañana sale a cultivar la tierra, junto a su esposa, quien incansablemente le ayuda en sus actividades diarias, y como su trabajo es rentable, le permite ahorrar para comprar más terrenos agrícolas. Le gusta observar sus sembríos limpios, bien surcados para regarlos  con facilidad, sin embargo, le disgusta salir muy temprano soportando el intenso frío, pero sabe que de esa manera sus cultivos crecerán rápido y al comercializarlos obtendrá regulares ganancias que recompensará todo su esfuerzo. Para más adelante planea sembrar en mayor cantidad, sobre todo papa y alverja que son los productos más solicitados en el mercado de la capital (Lima), a donde traslada sus cosechas, cuando se asocia con sus vecinos.Es  la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y esta feliz que la entidad financiera siga confiando en él ,  facilitándole el crédito  que le sirve como capital de trabajo, por eso le gusta laborar en su banco comunal.Walter tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono, que necesita para mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Walter, age 33, lives in his own house with his partner, 29 year old Nelly. They have four small children. For seven years he has been growing potatoes, beans, peas, corn, and vegetables. This activity has allowed him to buy his fields, build his house, and pay for his family’s necessities. Every morning he and his wife go to work their land. His wife tirelessly helps him with his daily activities. His work is profitable, which allows him to save to buy more farmland. He likes to look at his weed free plants, which are well ploughed in order to easily water them. Nevertheless, he does not like leaving very early and enduring the intense cold. But, he knows this way his crops will grow rapidly, and he will get regular income to compensate him for all of his efforts. Later he plans to plant in greater quantities. He will mostly plant potatoes and peas, which are the products that are most requested in the market in the capital (Lima). That is where he takes his crops when he collaborates with his neighbors. This is his sixth loan with MFP. He is happy that the financial institution continues to have faith in him. The institution provides him with the loan, which is for working capital. That is why he likes working with his communal bank. Walter plans to use the requested money to buy several sacks of fertilizer, which he needs to improve his production.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Elvio

texts.es:
El  señor es soltero, tiene 45 años de edad, el mismo es corredor  de quiniela (venta de juegos de azar), realiza sus ventas por toda la zona de Pilar; también es dueño de una empresa, taller de construcción de obras civiles donde realizan trabajos de todo tipo, como ser construcciones de obras civiles, reparaciones,etc. El Cliente cuenta con casa propia en el barrio Crucecita, en su residencia particular se refleja que cuenta con todas las comodidades para el bienestar de su vida cotidiana.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de ladrillos, cementos, mezcladoras y otros materiales que utilizara en las construcciones.
texts.en:
This man is 45 years old and single. He is a “quiniela” (Spanish equivalent of the football pools) agent (the sale of games of chance). He makes his sales all over the Pilar area. He also has a business, which is a shop for the construction of public works. They do all types of construction of public works and repairs, etc. He has his own house in the Crucecita neighborhood. Said residence has all of the amenities for convenience in his daily life. He is requesting a loan to buy bricks, cement, mixers, and other materials; which he will use on construction jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Yessika Carolina

texts.es:
la sra. Yessika Carolina Q. tiene 25 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Arle Humberto Paz con quien tiene un hijo, Arle se dedica la albañileria y los dos se ayudan economicamente con los gastos de la casa.
Yessika trabaja haciendo tortillas, vende a los vecinos y personas que viven cerca de su casa esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años, desde que era muy joven ya que con su mama han tenido que trabajar duro. crecieron solas sin un padre que les apoyara.

el credito lo utilizara para compra de maiz, leña, cal, agua y fosforos.
su mayor deseo es construir una casa para que viva ahí tambien su mama y que su hijo crezca sano y fuerte.
texts.en:
Yessika Carolina Q., age 25, is married to Arle Humberto, and they have one child. Arle is a bricklayer. They both help with the household expenses. Yessika makes tortillas, and she sells them to neighbors and people who live close to her house. She has been doing this for ten years, ever since she was a young girl. She and her mother had to work hard. They grew up alone without a father to support them. She will use the loan to buy corn, firewood, lime, water, and matches. Her greatest wish is to build a house. She would live there with her mother. She also wishes that her child will grow healthy and strong.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, firewood, lime, water, and matches

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Diego Manuel

texts.es: Diego Manuel tiene 45 años, su actividad económica es la venta de esquimos,  Tiene 3 hijos que dependen de él y asisten a clases. Su actividad económica es la venta de helados, gaseosas y hot- dog. Hace más de 19 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica, su negocio surgió por la falta de empleo con el objetivo de apoyar en los gastos de la casa, pues siempre está pensando en mejorar su actividad y proporcionarle a su familia lo que ellos necesitan. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de golosinas, gaseosas, pan, jugos entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Diego Manuel is 45 years old and earns his living by selling Eskimo dairy products such as ice cream, as well as soft drinks and hot dogs. He has three children who attend school. Diego has been doing this work for more than nineteen years. It came about because of the lack of work so he had to find a way to help with household expenses. He is always thinking of ways to improve the business and provide his family with what they need. The loan he is asking for will be used to buy candy, soft drinks, bread, and juices etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more stock

loans.name: Las Forjadoras De Palca Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Forjadoras D. Palca se encuentra ubicado en Palca, Comunidad perteneciente al departamento D. Huancavelica y caracterizada por sus plantaciones D. eucalipto, sus picigranjas y sus aguas termales, considerada como zona turística. Dentro D. sus actividades tenemos L. agricultura, artesanía, textilería y crianza D. cuyes.

Norma es casada y tiene 05 hijos D. 2, 5, 10, 13 y 16 años quienes se encuentran estudiando. Norma, tiene como negocio una cabina D. internet y una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes. ElL., inició su negocio con un pequeño proyector, reproduciendo películas, ya que no existen salas D. cine en su ciudad. Pese a que a veces no contaban con electricidad, y su esposo trabajaba lejos D. su familia y lo extrañaban, elL. nunca bajo los brazos y siempre siguió adelante. Norma, necesita algunos accesorios para las computadoras que usa en su cabina D. internet y para ello requiere D. un préstamo. Norma, tiene como meta expandir su negocio y adminístralo con su esposo  y con su ahorros poder educar a sus hijos.

Donata es viuda y tiene un hijo D. 24 años que ya se encuentra estudiando en L. Universidad. Donata, tras el fallecimiento D. su esposo, se dedicó a L. venta D. pescado frito, pese a que sentía vergüenza, a L. competencia y sentirse enferma, tuvo que seguir adelante, pues era consiente que elL. tenía que velar por su familia. Donata, aprendió a ahorrar, a luchar y se considera una mujer trinfadora. Ahora elL. quiere implementar su negocio, con una nueva cocina y vender en L. plaza D. su ciudad; también quiere llevar granos para venderlos a L. capital. Su meta, es que su hijo sea profesional.

Alejandrina es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos D. 8 y 10 años D. edad. Alejandrina, junto con su esposo tenían una panadería en L. capital; años después tuvo que regresar a su pueblo, donD. se sentía extraña, pues nadie L. recordaba. Alejandrina, gracias a sus préstamos pudo reabrir L. bodega que tenía su madre. Alejandrinaa tuvo que afrontar momentos muy difíciles, como el del accidente D. tránsito que sufrió su esposo y del cual fue el único sobreviviente. Alejandrina quiere invertir en su negocio comprando verduras y tubérculos. Alejandra tiene como meta el volver a tener una panadería, pero esta vez más granD. D. L. que tenía en L. capital.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Forjadoras D. Palca" is located in Palca, a community belonging to the Huancavelica department, which is known for its eucalyptus plantations, its fish farms, and its hot spring resorts. It is considered to be a tourist area. Among the economic activities there are agriculture, handicrafts, textiles, and the raising of guinea pigs. Norma is married and has five children aged 2, 5, 10, 13 and 16 who are in school. Norma has an internet cafe business and a small grocery store. She started her business with a small projector, playing movies, as there are no movie theaters in her city. In spite of the fact that at times she did not have electricity, and her husband worked far away from the family and they missed him, she never gave up and always continued to push ahead. Norma needs some computer accessories for her internet cafe, and for this she needs a loan. Norma's goal is to expand her business and run it with her husband, so that with their savings they can education their children. Donato is a widow who has a 24 year-old son who is studying at the university. After the death of her husband, Donato started selling fried fish. At first she was shy, and the competitive pressures of the market maD. her feel very uncomfortable, but in spite of this she had to push ahead, because she knew that she had to take care of her family. Donata learned to save and to strive and she is considered to be a successful woman. Now she wants to equip her business with a new kitchen, and sell in the plaza of her city. In addition, she wants to take grains to sell in the capital. Her goal is to have her son become a professional. Alejandrina lives with a partner and has 2 children aged 8 and 10. Alejandrina, along with her husband, had a bakery in the capital. Years later she had to return to her town where she felt like a stranger, because nobody remembered her. Alejandrina, thanks to her loans, was able to reopen a store that her mother had. Alejandrina had to confront some very difficult moments, such as the traffic accident that her husband suffered, and from which he was the only survivor. Alejandrina wants to invest in her business selling vegetables and tubers. Alejandra's goal is to have a bakery again, but this time much larger than the one she had in the capital.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy computer accessories

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
El señor Leonardo tiene 46 años, esta casado con la señora Antoliana Areco Aquino desde hace 20 años, tienen 3 hijos de 19, 17 y 15 años.
Leonardo anteriormente era el encargado del mantenimiento del jardín de una empresa del estado. Así fue que en un momento dado decidió alquilar un terreno para poder plantar algunas semillas de plantitas de jardín, una vez que las mismas crecían  quería comercializarlas en  la empresa donde trabajaba.
Hace 9 años aproximadamente decidió salir de la empresa y dedicarse de lleno al vivero donde le lleva todo el tiempo tanto a él como toda su familia.
Leonardo lo que mas anhela es seguir ampliando su vivero y también mediante sus ingreso sus hijos culminen sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
46-year old Leonardo has been married to Sra. Antoliana Areco Aquino for twenty years. They have three children aged 19, 17, and 15 years. Leonardo used to be in charge of the gardens at a state enterprise. Then one day he decided to rent a piece of land and sow garden plant seeds. Once they had grown, he would sell them to the business where he was working. Approximately nine years ago he decided to leave the business and devote himself full-time to the plant nursery. Leonardo and his whole family now work there all the time. His greatest wish is to continue expanding the nursery and also to have enough money for his children to finish university.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies for his plant nursery

loans.name: Rosa Marlene

texts.es:
la señora Rosa Marlene V. tiene 40 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Jose Gimenez quien se dedica al negocio del transporte desde hace mucho tiempo y Rosa Marlene atiende la pulperia y un molino de moler maiz que tiene en su casa de habitacion, tiene 4 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
el credito lo utilizara para invertirlo en la compra de mercaderia para surtir mas su negocio y comprar refrescos al por mayor.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar y de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Marlene V. is 40 years old. She is married to Jose Gimenez who has been involved in the transportation business for a long time. Rosa Marlene attends to the store and a mill for grinding corn that she has in her house. She has been in this business for four years. She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise to stock her business and purchase wholesale drinks. She needs the earnings to cover the household and family costs.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beans, rice, sugar, toilet paper, cereal, milk, soups, churros, drinks, bread, cookies, coffee, and candles.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Asunciona

texts.es:
Asunciona es una madre D. familia D. 50 años D. edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos en el caserío La Raya, una zona rural del distrito D. Túcume, un distrito conocido a nivel nacional por su atractivo turístico: cuenta con un complejo D. 26 pirámides D. barro construídos por civilizaciones anteriores a los Incas, sus principales actividades son la agricultura y el comercio, pertenece a la provincia D. Lambayeqque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace más D. 5 años a la venta D. verduras en un pequeño puesto instalado en los exteriores del mercado del distrito D. Túcume, ella compra su mercadería en el mercado mayorista D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo y a los agricultores D. la zona, esta actividad la realiza todos los dias y le permite ayudar a su esposo, que es agricultor, con los gastos familiares.

Asunciona desea adquirir más verduras para aumentar sus ventas y percibir mas ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es tener un puesto instalado dentro del mercado, esto le permitirá tener mayor estabilidad para su negocio. Ella es una mujer amable y muy trabajadora, sus vecinos y conocidos la estiman y respetan mucho.
texts.en:
Asunciona is a 50-year old mother of a family. She lives together with her husband and her children in the village of La Raya, a rural area of the Túcume district, a district known at the national level for its tourist attraction: it has a complex of 26 clay pyramids built by pre-Incan civilizations. Their main businesses are agriculture and traD. and it belongs to the province of Lambayeque, located an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than 5 years she has sold vegetables in a small stand set up in the outer areas of the Túcume district market. She purchases her merchandise in the wholesale market of the city of Chiclayo and from the farmers in the area. She works everyday and it allows her to help her husband, who is a farmer, with the household expenses.

Asunciona wants to have more vegetables to increase her sales and receive more earnings to achieve her goal. She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 1000 PEN.

Her greatest wish is to have a stand set up insiD. of the market. This will allow her to have greater stability for her business. She is a friendly and very hardworking woman. Her neighbors and acquaintances value and respect her very much.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables to expand her sales business in the market.

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
la sra. Ana Cristina M. tiene 23 años de edad, tiene un hijo y su esposo se encuentra trabajando en los Estados Unidos de donde le envia dinero para que termine la casa que estan construyendo. en estos momentos vive comodamente con su hijo y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en donde vende granos basicos, manteca, frescos y otros productos de la canasta basica familiar.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de otros productos que le hacen falta en su negocio para tener una mejor variedad y asi poder darles una mejor atencion a sus clientes.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y salir adelante con su hijo.
texts.en:
Ana Cristina M. is 23 years old. She has one son and her husband is working in the United States from where he sends her Money to finish the house that they are building. She currently lives comfortably with her son and she sells general food products. She has a store where she sells basic grains, butter, sodas and other basic products that a family needs.

She will use the loan for the purchase of other products that she does not have in her business so that she has better variety and this way, she can provide better service to her customers. She needs the earnings to cover housing costs and to get ahead with her son.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of butter, oil, beans, tortillas, corn flour, coffee, bread, cookies, sugar, rice, toilet paper, sanitary pads, batteries, candles, eggs, churros, sodas, juices, salsas, pastas, soaps, and pills

loans.name: Astrid Aracelly

texts.es: Astrid Aracelly tiene 27 años, su actividad venta de cosméticos y ropa. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues siempre ha buscado como sacar a su familia adelante por lo que ha demostrado que su familia es lo más importante y lo apoyan con su actividad. Se encuentra muy alegre con esta oportunidad que le brindaron pues tiene 2 hijos que mantener y proporcionarle estudios. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de materia como pinturas de uñas, pinturas de labios, polvos y ropa interior.
texts.en:
Astrid Aracelly is 27 years old, she sells cosmetics and clothing. She has been in this business for more than 4 years. She has continually searched for ways to help her family advance in life. Her family is most important to her and they support her business. She is very happy with this opportunity, it has allowed her 2 children to maintain their studies. The funding that she is seeking will go towards working capital. It will be used to buy supplies such as nail polish, lipstick, powder, and underwear.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria De Los Ángeles tiene 26 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de refrescos. Hace más de 11 años que dio inicio a esta actividad pues siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar sus ingresos y los de su familia. hace más de 11 años con este negocio pues no es el primer crédito que ha realizado, por lo que se siente muy agradecida pues lo que ofrece son las tajaditas, enchiladas, yuca, refrescos, es por eso que solicita este financiamiento con el fin de mejorar su actividad para la compra de materia prima. Sueña con sus hijas puedan finalizar sus estudios y establecer otro medio de ingreso.
texts.en:
Maria De Los Ángeles is 26 years old. Her economic activity is selling refreshments. She started this activity over 11 years ago. She was always concerned about improving her earnings and those of her family. She has been in this business for over 11 years. This is not her first loan, and she is very grateful. She sells fried plantain slices, enchiladas, yucca, and soft drinks. She is requesting a loan to improve her activity by purchasing raw material. She dreams that her daughters will finish their education and establish another means of income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maritza Oristila

texts.es:
la señora Maritza Oristila F. D. tiene 23 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Jesus Dinelio Moran Bonilla tienen dos hijos, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y Maritza a la venta de queso, mantequilla, cuajada, tambien hace pan  y tamales.
las ganancias que le genera este negocio las necesita para poder salir adelante junto con su familia. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra del producto lacteo que ella vende y tambien para comprar los materiales para hacer los panes y los tamales.

su deseo es poder darles una mejor calidad de vida y estudios a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Maritza Oristila F. D. is 23, married to Jesus Dinelio Moran Bonilla and they have two children. Her husband works in agriculture and Maritza sells cheese, butter and curd, and also makes bread and tamales. The earnings generated from this business are needed for her and her family's success. The loan will be used for the purchase of the dairy products that she sells and also for the purchase of materials for making bread and tamales. She wants to give a better quality of life and education to her two children.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cheese, butter, corn, firewood

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lady Diana

texts.es: La solicitante es madre soltera, vive en la casa de su padre, quien viaja constantemente ya que es chofer. Se dedica a la venta de cervezas y pisco desde hace 2 años, aparte vende productos de belleza de manera indirecta. Esporadicamente vende comida o piqueos para sus clientes que consumen licor. Solicita el credito para compra de mesas, sillas, vitrina y capital de trabajo
texts.en:
Diana is a single mother, who lives at home with his father, he travels constantly because he is a driver. She works selling beer and pisco since she was 2 years old, she also sells beauty products directly. From time to time she also sells food and snacks to the clients that buy beer. She is requesting the loan to buy tables, chairs and working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs and working capital

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité Nueva Esperanza del barrio Villa Salvador de la ciudad de Luque y se encuentran trabajando dentro del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya. 

Una  de las integrantes es la señora Francisca C.  quien se dedica a la venta de hiervas medicinales  en la zona del mercado de la ciudad  por la mañana por la tarde recorre varios negocios  para ofrecer sus medinas naturales.
Ella solicitó el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de mas medicinas naturales así podrá cubrir todos los pedidos que tiene
texts.en:
The Nueva Esperanza ("New Hope") group is from the Villa Salvador neighbourhood in the city of Luque and are working in the Comite de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundacion Paraguaya ("Fundacion Paraguaya's Committee of Women Entrepreneurs"). One of the members is Francisca C., who sells medicinal herbs in the market area of the city in the mornings. In the afternoons she visits businesses to offer her natural medicines. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of natural medicines to cover all of her orders.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Natural medicines

loans.name: Elva Del Pilar

texts.es:
Elva tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo, vive junto a su familia en Nueva Arica, un distrito dedicado principalmente a actividades agrícolas como la ganadería y el cultivo de tabaco, se encuentra ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la preparación y venta de comida, ella prepara alimentos en su domicilio y los vende a los trabajadores agrícolas que radican temporalmente en la zona, esta actividad tiene bastante demanda ya que ella prepara sus platos con buena sazón, los ingresos que percibe le permiten ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.

Elva desea adquirir más insumos para preparar más platos de comida y aumentar sus ventas. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Elva es una mujer bastante responsable y que gusta mucho de su trabajo. En la zona donde reside sus vecinos la consideran una persona carismática y de confianza.
texts.en:
Elva is 30, married with one child, and lives with her family in Nueva Arica, a district dedicated primarily to agricultura activities such as livestock and tobacco cultivation. It is located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. For three years she has made and sold food. She prepares food in her home and sells it to the agricultural workers who settle temporarily in the area. This activity has a lot of demand as she prepares her dishes with good seasoning. Her income allows her to help her husband with family costs. Elva wants to acquire more ingredients to prepare more food and increase her sales. In order to achieve her goal she has requested her first loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Elva is a very responsible woman who lives her work. In her neighbourhood, her neighbours consider her to be a charismatic and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients for food production and sales

loans.name: Maria Nilda

texts.es:
la señora Maria Nilda E. V. tiene 39 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene 3 hijos que dependen de ella,   Maria se dedica a vender tortillas, baleadas, chocobananos tiene 2 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, el credito lo utilizara para la compra harina de trigo, frijoles, queso, mantequilla, huevos, bananos y chocolate en polvo para hacer los chocobananos y para elaborar las baleadas.

Maria vive con sus tres hijos dos de ellos estudian en el colegio y la otra esta en la escuela, su meta es graduar a sus hijos y darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Nilda E. Vasques is 39, divorced and has 3 dependent children. Maria sells tortillas, baleadas [popular Honduran tortilla containing beans, grated cheese and butter] and chocobananos [chocolate bananas with peanuts]. She has been doing this for two years. This loan will be used for the purchase of wheat flour, beans, cheese, butter, eggs, bananas and powdered chocolate to make her chocobananos and baleadas. Maria lives with her three children, two of whom study in college and the other in school. Her goal is for her children to graduate and to give them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of bananas, powdered chocolate, wheat flour, beans, cheese, butter, eggs, lard and oil

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: La Fuente Group

texts.es:
El grupo la fuente está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas provenientes de Masaya, cuna del folklor Nicaragüense. La coordinadora es la señora Cristela Sofía A. de 25 años, ella inició hace seis años con la producción de almohadas, cortinas, fundas, ropa de cama, mosquiteros entre otros productos.

El negocio a lo largo de este tiempo fue creciendo y mejorando con cada préstamo, A. actualmente  invertirá el crédito en telas e hilos para poder aumentar su producción y sacar adelante a sus dos pequeños de seis y tres años. 

Sus compañeras de grupo son Flora Velázquez S. quien vende granos básicos y con el crédito comprar quintal de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, maíz, harina, aceite y Sadia María  López Icabalceta comenzó con unas cuantas enchiladas en 2,000 y hoy en día tiene una fritanga.
texts.en:
The group La Fuente is composed of three hard working women from Masaya, the birth place of Nicaraguan folklore. The coordinator of La Fuente is Mrs. Cristela Sofía A.. She is 25 years old and has been producing pillows, curtains, pillow cases, bed linen, and mosquito nets, among other products, for six years. Over this time and with each new loan, the business has been growing and improving. A. will now invest the loan in fabric and thread in order to increase the production and raise her two children, aged three and six years. Her group mates are Flora Velázquez S. and Zadia María López Icabalceta. Velázquez S. sells basic grains and plans to use the loan to buy a quintal of rice, sugar, beans, corn, flour and oil. López Icabalceta began with a few enchiladas in 2000 and now she owns a fried food business.

Translated from Spanish by Liliana Matos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Reyna Elisabeth

texts.es:
la sra. Reyna Elisabet V. R. tiene 47 años de edad, es viuda y vive con sus 4 hijos que todos estan estudiando.
tiene 40 años de vivir en la aldea el Moraicito su un nivel de vida es modesto y se dedica a la  venta de abarroteria y refrescos, ademas recibe ingresos de un molino que tiene en su casa, en donde vienen a moler maiz los pobladores de la comunidad.
su negocio se ve fuerte y esta ubicado en muy buen lugar, cuenta con parqueo para vehiculos para los clientes, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de refrescos, abarroteria en general.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Reyna Elisabet V. R. is a 47 year old widow. She lives with her four children; all of them are in school. She has lived in the Moraicito village for 40 years. She has a modest standard of living. She sells groceries and soft drinks. She also receives income from a mill that she has in her house. Community members come to her house to grind corn. Her business is strong. It is located in a very good place, and it has a place for customers to park. She will use the loan to buy soft drinks and general groceries. She needs the income to get ahead with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beans, rice, sugar, bread, soft drinks, shortening, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, candles, eggs, tortillas, corn and wheat flour, preserves, milk, cheese, sausages, chicken, soup, condiments, salt, salsas, and basic grains

loans.name: Glenda Rosibel

texts.es:
la señora Glenda Rosibel C. T. tiene 22 años de edad, vive en en union libre con el señor Jose Serapio Garcia Zeron quien le ayuda con los gastos de los alimentos para el hogar. tienen una hija pequeña.
Glenda tiene un negocio de elaboracion y venta de papas y productos de soya, estos churros los realiza junto con su suegra en su casa de habitacion, tiene poco tiempo de realizar este tipo de actividad.
el credito lo utilizara  para compra de la materia prima para elaborar las papas y comprar salsas y bolsas para empaque. su mayor deseo es que su hijo crezca sano y saludable.
texts.en:
Glenda is 22 years old and lives in common law marriage with Jose, who helps her with household food expenses. They have a small daughter. Glenda has a business producing and selling potato crisps and soy products. She makes the chips together with her mother-in-law in her house. She has little time to do this type of activity. Glenda will use the loan to buy raw materials for making the chips and to buy sauces and bags for packaging. Her greatest wish is that her child grow up safe and healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of oil, potatoes, soy products and packaging

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Santos Melania

texts.es:
la señora Santos Melania T. tiene 59 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, su actividad diaria es atender su pulperia que esta ubicada en su casa de habitacion,  sus ventas son 
todos los dias con los pobladores de la comunidad, su pulperia esta ubicada en punto estrategico y le va bien.
vive en la comunidad del Moraicito desde hace 40 años.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria y refrescos.
se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 1 año, anteriormente se dedicaba a vender otro tipo de productos.

su sueño es tener una pulperia grande para cubrir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Melania T. is fifty-nine, single and has no dependent children. Her daily life involves tending the small grocery store she has in her house, where she sells to the inhabitants of her community. Her store is strategically located and things are going well for her. She's been living in the Moraicito community for forty years. She plans to use her loan to buy groceries and soft drinks. Melania has been in business for a year; earlier she earned her living selling other types of products. Her dream is to have a large grocery store so she can meet all of her customers' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tortillas, bread, coffee, batteries, rice, sugar, candy, soft drinks, juices, oils, beans, cookies, milk, medicine tablets, light bulbs, flour, soups, and cool aid

loans.name: Mileibi

texts.es: La señora Mileibi E. B.ha soñado con poder tener una vivienda propia, en donde pueda ofrecerle una  mejor condición social a sus dos pequeños hijos de 3 y 6 años de edad, actualmente con la ayuda de los financiamientos obtenidos por parte de Ceprodel ella junto con su marido han logrado construir la mayor parte de su vivienda sin embargo les hace falta el techo para lo cual recurren a solicitar nuevamente un financiamiento para terminar de construir. La señora Mileibi se dedica a impartir clases de educación primaria en donde desarrolla una jornada laboral de 7 horas, al igual que ella su marido también realiza trabajos de crianza y producción de ganado al igual que cultivos agrícolas, con los cuales se ayudan en sus ingresos para la mantención familiar, ambos sueñan con llegar tener un mejor hato ganadero y su vivienda digna para habitar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mileibi E. B.has been dreaming of having her own home, where she could provide a better social environment to her two small children of 3 and 6 years of age. Currently, with the help of the loans from Ceprodel, she and her husband have constructed the major part of their house. They still need a roof, however, and this is the reason for their current loan request, to be able to finish the construction. Mrs. Mileibi works at teaching elementary school putting in a 7 hour work day. At the same time, she and her husband work at raising cattle and farming, which help to increase their income for the support of their family. They both dream of having a better herd of cattle and a decent home to live in.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material: roof tile, wood, nails, etc..

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en el distrito de Nueva Arica, una zona dedicada principalmente a actividades agrícolas como la ganadería y el cultivo de tabaco, se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a la crianza y venta de animales, el cría aves de corral y animales menores en corrales situados en la parte posterior de su vivienda, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan frecuentemente la zona para revender los animales en el distrito de Cayaltí o en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le permiten solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a sus padres en el sostenimiento de los gastos familiares, Carlos desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Carlos es un joven tranquilo y responsable. Sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y confianza, siempre encuentran en el a alquien dispuesto a ayudarlos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 22 years old, single, and lives in his parents' house in Nueva Arica District, an area dedicated primarily to agricultural activities like ranching and tobacco farming. It is located one and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo. For two years, Carlos has worked raising and selling animals. He raises poultry and small animals in pens behind his house. When they have reached a good size, he offers them for sale to businessmen who frequently visit the area to resell the animals in Cayaltí District or in Chiclayo. The income he receives from this business allows him to cover his personal expenses and help his parents with the family's expenses. Carlos wants to expand his business by buying more animals and balanced feed. For this reason, he has for the first time asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 new soles. Carlos is a calm and responsible young man. His neighbors and acquaintances hold him in great esteem and have a lot of confidence in him; they always find in him someone who is ready to help them.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals and balanced feed for expansion of business raising and selling animals

loans.name: Rumbo Al Exito Group

texts.es:
Lisette tiene su restaurante tiene por nombre "VALERY" el nombre lo escogió por su hija, ella  tiene 04 hijos que son su mayor incentivo para seguir trabajando, cuando ella era soltera trabajaba como anfitriona y tenia carisma para las ventas, ya casada fue su esposo quien se animo a poner su propio restaurante aprovechando que le estaban ofreciendo un traspaso con todo los utensilios necesarios  fue así que se iniciaron vendiendo almuerzos y menú que ofrecían al publico teniendo mucha acogida, en el futuro quieren ampliar su local usando todo el primer piso para dicho fin.
Lamentablemente este año tuvieron inconvenientes por que uno de sus hijos enfermo y esta en tratamiento pero sabe que su situación mejorara, con el dinero de su préstamo podrá comprar insumos para reflotar su restaurante y mejorarlo, Lisette es la tesorera del grupo “RUMBO AL ÉXITO”  ya pertenece al grupo cerca de un año.

* La Sra Lissette aparece en la foto cargando su bebe es la quinta de las señoras paradas.
texts.en:
Lisette has a restaurant called "Vallery" on her daughter's honor, she has 4 kids who are her biggest incentive, when she was single she used to work as a hostess and was very good at sales, once she got married her husband decided to open a restaurant as there was an offer of a place with all the equipment. That is how they started selling lunch and their menu had very good acceptance, in the future they want to improve their place using all the space on the first floor. Unfortunately they had troubles this year as one of their kids got sick and is undergoing medical treatment, and his condition is improving, with the loan they will be able to buy food supplies for the restaurant and improve it, Lisette is the treasurer of the group called "Road to Success" and belongs to the group for the last past year. * Mrs. Lisette appears on the picture carrying her baby, is the fifth of the ladies who are standing.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Yurem Group

texts.es:
Yurem es un grupo conformado tres féminas excepcionales una de ellas es María José G. V. quien tiene una pequeña panadería. Este negocio fue formado por muchos años de trabajo arduo, en familia y con muchos deseos de superación por sus suegros quienes de tempranas y alta hora de la noche realizan variedades de pan. Actualmente la panadería la administra está joven de 22 años junto con su esposo los cuales se distribuyen el trabajo.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Martha F. Ordoñez quien se dedica al comercio de ropa usada o nueva de manera ambulante desde hace siete años y Zulmira M. R. quien vende ropa y sueña con que su negocio prospere.
texts.en:
Yurem is a group made up of three exceptional women. One of them is María José G. V., who has a small bakery. This business was formed through many years of hard work, with her family and with the great desires to get ahead from her in laws who early in the morning and late at night prepare various types of bread. Currently this bakery is run by this young 22 year old who shares the work with her husband. Her partners in the group are Martha F. Ordoñez, who for the last seven years works in the business of selling used or new clothing as a street vendor, and Zulmira M. R. who sells clothing and dreams of making her business prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raw materials such as flour, yeast, sugar, etc..

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina es socia del Bancomunal Paloma, es casada, tiene 9 hijos y 8 nietos. Delfina tiene un negocio D. venta D. abarrotes en su casa, ella ha sido negociante desD. pequeña, viajaba acompañando a su padre a Cangallo para traer productos, así aprendió a ser negociante, actualmente ella maneja su negocio con el apoyo D. sus hijos, su esposo trabaja en un instituto pedagógico, ambos aportan para el hogar.
Delfina tiene 18 años aproximadamente en FINCA Perú, gracias a los préstamos que ha recibido pudo abrir su negocio e ir aumentando sus ventas, con sus ahorros ha podido construir su casa D. material noble, su sueño es terminar su segundo piso.
Delfina solicita un préstamo D. 2600 soles para invertir en la compra D. arroz, azúcar por sacos, comprando al por mayor.
texts.en:
Delfina belongs to the Paloma Village Bank. She's married and has nine children and eight grandchildren. She has a grocery store in her house. She's been a businesswoman since she was small, having learned the business when she used to travel with her father to Cangallo delivering products.
